Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the third largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in fourteen countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco ranks seventh in Forbes “World’s Best Employers”.

This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others.

Come join the Costco Wholesale IT family. Costco IT is a dynamic, fast-paced environment, working through exciting transformation efforts. We are building the next generation retail environment where you will be surrounded by dedicated and highly professional employees.




IT Purchasing Analysts perform and manage the execution of Costco IT procure-to-pay sourcing and Supply Chain initiatives for large scale projects, upgrades, inventory management and IT operations. They manage products, services, software and suppliers, throughout the procure-to-pay life cycle within the company's procurement systems, and inventory. IT Purchasing Analysts aggregate data from the procurement systems and from external systems reporting on: vendor performance, quarterly business reviews, SOX compliance and supplier assessments. They assess budget compliance, CapEx versus OpEx expenditures, reviewing and assessing IT procure-to-pay services against contracted and billable services, and report on discrepancies and savings. IT Purchasing Analysts leverage and apply supply chain, sourcing, negotiation, and inventory management best practices, and apply such methodologies to support procure-to-pay decisions to comply with company objectives and improve project deployment metrics. IT Purchasing Analysts are responsible for procurement forecasting, product roadmaps, product management, inventory stock management, and product distribution management year over year.

Purchasing Analysts perform activities related to the buying, forecasting and managing of materials, equipment, and services for internal company use. The selected candidate will implement and communicate company policies and procedures for IT purchasing; review purchase requests for completeness and compliance with company requirements; strategically source and negotiate pricing and availability with suppliers; and approve purchases of authorized amounts or size. Purchasing Analysts verify, validate and update purchasing orders, systems, and documentation as well as update and track the cost, schedule, and performance metrics. Purchasing Analyst will also be responsible for the management, coordination and implementation of the procurement catalogs both in-house and with our suppliers.

If you want to be a part of one of the worldwide BEST companies “to work for”, simply apply and let your career be reimagined.




ROLE

Drives and takes action of procure-to-pay processes and queues associated with services, inventory, projects, vendors, hardware and software.
Determines and verifies compliance with policies procedures and financial operations engaging with appropriate parties associated with procure-to-pay activities.
Develops scorecards to measure the health of the system and tools against departmental goals by identifying projects/initiatives for further investigation based on data research.
Improves and streamlines solutions to problems and processes using appropriate data aggregation techniques from multiple sources to promote efficiencies across all departments.
Performs periodic inventory reviews and assessments with vendors and business partners by making recommendations and resolving any issues or discrepancies.
Facilitates strategic sourcing recommendations and assesses vendor contractual compliance.
Strategically sources and negotiates with vendors on products and services, engages with appropriate stakeholders to drive Request for Proposals (RFPs)/Requests for Information (RFIs) to meet business needs, reduce cost, and reduce risk.
Drives the analysis for KPI reporting efforts, financial reports, and alignment with fiscal requirements.
Monitors and maintains request queues and Purchase Order (PO) requisitions associated with services and hardware and software orders.
Validates, verifies, and updates all necessary documentation and engages with all appropriate parties that need to be a part of submitted requisitions., and POs prior to approval.
Ensures a clear understanding of the requests, projects, and process with those involved.
Engages with all necessary business areas that are responsible for maintaining stock rooms, to ensure they are inventoried and have adequate inventory level.
Collaborates and engages with accounting to ensure PO and invoice match, reconciliation and exceptions, payment approval, on time collection, and invoice payment.
Tracks and updates the cost, schedule, and performance metrics of contracts and subcontracts.
Ensures requests are processed correctly, accurately, and in compliance.
Collaborates with suppliers, and provides forecasting, along with negotiating pricing and terms for purchasing products and/or services to meet the business needs and requirements.
Works with business areas to prepare for future projects and business needs. Verifies products; obtains necessary specifications, time frames, and quantities; develops the plan to sync the supplier(s) with the business needs; provides continuous communications with all involved.
Sources and negotiates with suppliers on product and service availability, along with lead times, inventory, security, pricing, shipping, support, etc.
Collaborates with Asset Management to manage and monitor Costco owned inventory with business areas, suppliers, Accounts Payable, and Fixed Assets to ensure that our suppliers are being paid on time and all appropriate asset information is being applied to the asset register (i.e. Cap versus Exp).
Tracks Costco owned inventory count and works with business areas to reduce stock inventory.
Engages with business areas to drive Requests for Information (RFIs) to meet needs.
Analyzes data and identifies trends in product production and desirability.
Identifies and resolves problems (i.e. forecasting, inventory, shipping, availability, etc.), often anticipating issues before they occur or before they grow; develops and evaluates options and implements solutions.



REQUIRED

Proficient in the use of spreadsheets, word processing tools, and Costco internal financial systems.
Working knowledge of Costco Accounting methods, including general ledger and journal entries.
Methodical, detail-oriented, and demonstrates the ability to research effectively.
Excellent organizational skills.
Previous experience successfully managing multiple projects and tasks.
Excellent problem-solving and customer service skills.
Proven strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to adjust communication to a particular situation and all levels of senior management, management, employees, and outside suppliers.
History of providing superior member service over the phone and in person.
Willingness to take direction and coaching; excellent team interaction.
Good understanding of Costco Business operations.
Works well in pressure situations.
Flexible and adaptable to changes.
Possesses a positive attitude, has the ability to work independently, and is self-motivated.
Recommended
Previous experience with Costco’s hardware configurations, i.e. Register Systems, PCs, Printers, Networking, etc.
Data mining and analysis, along with reporting a plus.
Developing, managing, and maintaining budgets a plus.
Previous knowledge and skills associated with supplier and contract negotiations.
Knowledge and experience with ServiceNow (CARTS+), and/or SAP (Ariba).

The DaVita Enterprise Risk Services (ERS) Department (Internal Audit) is seeking energetic, motivated individuals to join our dynamic, transforming team! The Senior Data Analyst will work on internal audit assurance and advisory projects that address risk across the DaVita enterprise, which includes both domestic and international operations. Leading projects to build continuous auditing and monitoring tests utilizing SQL and other programming languages and software (R, Python, Tableau, Alteryx, etc.) partnering with team members and business partners to understand the processes, data and desired outcomes.
Explore and develop new technology solutions including RPA
Providing support to ERS teams to help ensure departmental goals and objectives are achieved, in alignment with DaVita’s Mission and Core Values. Support functions include data gathering and analytics for audits, dashboard development / preparation, audit project consulting on a variety of topics including financial statements, Travel & Entertainment (T&E), fraud and others.
Assisting with the execution of risk assessments, compiling and reporting on metrics, Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Key Risk Indicators (KRIs) to facilitate the quantification of risk.
Effectively communicating and collaborating with the ERS teams and business partners to provide value added data analysis.

Design and build analytics using a blend of various tools and technologies to accomplish stated objectives.

You will be working for a midsized company with great people and a history of steady growth and profitability. Sound like a match? If you are prepared to work in an exciting and rewarding environment, we look forward to considering your experience and qualifications.

WHAT YOU WILL BE WORKING ON

The role will learn Supply Chain (Purchasing, Commodity Management) and Quality Control Laboratory operations to build necessary infrastructure for reporting, dashboards, systems, glass pipeline, heat maps,
Data Policy
Develop recommendation for standardized method for deployment across data structures.

Data accuracy, integrity and compliance across ERP and other systems / software with gap closing
This position will lead data mining & analysis activities to enable actionable directives for team members to execute against and deliver.
Sustain organizational Power BI (business intelligence) systems, dashboards & metrics (upstream & downstream). Drive continuous improvement.

Supply Chain Management
Current: Rapid Ratings, Supplier Portal, Supplier Diversity, Audit Dates / Tiers, Green Chemicals, 3TG + Co, Country of Origin (COO), Conflict Minerals, Diversity Spend, SRS and BCP

Quality Control Laboratory
Current: Operational Metrics

Make effective use of appropriate software including Excel, JMP, North West Analyst (NWA) and other platforms that support data summaries and analysis.
Develop data-based summaries for internal and external customers that support short- and long- term company and department goals including protection of MLI and customer intellectual property.
Partner effectively with stakeholders in MLI departments to understand and align on requirements for summaries needed including relevant data, models, charts, graphs, and other data analysis and summarization techniques.
Facilitate effective communication across internal departments by tracking, graphing, and reporting data.
Support the development of dashboards that provide effective summaries of status for departments and stakeholders for key performance metrics.
Establish clear need dates with customers and provide reliable commit dates for requested analyses. Escalate to Manager and stakeholder when priorities, need dates, and commitments are not aligned.

Enter, transcribe, record, store, or maintain information in physical or digital form.

Job Title: Data Analyst 3, Customer Analytics (Hybrid, Seattle and Los Angeles)
Job Description:
Job Description

Who we are...

Nordstrom is reinventing the retail industry through the power of data and artificial intelligence. The vision for Data Science & Analytics at Nordstrom is to be the best data-driven fashion retailer in the world, and we win by being relevant to the customer through an application of insight and prediction to outcomes.

The Data Analyst 3 role on the Customer Analytics team is responsible for collecting, analyzing and presenting data to improve decision making around the customer experience. This individual should have a high degree of curiosity about the business and the skills to discover impactful insights from data. They should be able to communicate those insights in a way that builds confidence and enables decisions that drive business value.

We are part of the Nordstrom’s Customer Analytics, Strategy team with the focus on supporting executive management with robust decision support data science. Here we build data science products and provide analytics consulting in support of strategic business decisions, including customer personalization, marketing, merchandise, supply chain, and digital experience. We work as the quantitative right-hand for the executive team with a passion for supporting data-driven decision making, a devotion to advanced techniques, along with a creative team spirit!

The ideal candidate is a creative self-starter and strong technical contributor who is always looking for new opportunities to solve business problems with data-driven tools. We welcome your curiosity about the business, your passion to unlock rich, nuanced insights from complicated data and the desire to communicate those insights in a way that drives positive business outcomes.

We are committed to building teams that reflect the diversity of our customers and active inclusion is core to how Nordstrom wins. We’re an equal opportunity employer and encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply. If the idea to make a difference in this vibrant intersection of fashion, data science, and technology excites you, join our world-class data science team!

A day in the life…

Partner with key stakeholders to define success and develop measurement frameworks
Dive deep into complex business problems and provide insights on merch performance through hypothesis testing
Responsible for delivering a suite of analytical products include analyses, dashboards, insights, and recommendations.
Present the results to the stakeholders up to executive level and guide them to make the best use of analytics in their domain.
Own the definition and implementation of new metrics.
Find opportunities to use data to develop new strategies and improve overall performance.
Deliver high quality solutions and recommendations to a variety of problems both independently and through the collaboration with team members and business partners to
Bring data to life through storytelling in a clear and meaningful way to audiences with mixed levels of technical expertise.
Reconcile divergent demands from multiple stakeholders in a fast-paced work environment.
Mentor more junior team members on analytics, storytelling and communication best practices.
Influence and support the Center of Excellence standards and best practices of analytics.
Use advanced analytical and statistical practices to create thorough and actionable insights..

You own this if you have…

Bachelors Degree in quantitative field (or equivalent experience)
5+ years of professional experience analyzing complex data, drawing conclusions, and making recommendations.
3+ years of experience in extracting & manipulating large data sets from various relational databases using SQL (Amazon Redshift, Oracle, Teradata preferred).
Strong problem solving skills - Is able to complete ambiguous projects independently & plan out the priority order of tasks; find the right resources to complete the tasks and make smart decisions regarding trade-offs.
Strong coding skills in at least one statistical or programming language (R or Python preferred) to import, summarize, and analyze data.
Experience with statistical and machine learning algorithms (e.g. regression, classification and/or clustering).
Proficiency with graphics/visualization software (e.g. Shiny, ggplot, matplotlib, Tableau).
Ability to be flexible and work in a fast-paced and dynamic organization
Clear and effective written and verbal communication and strong interpersonal skills

You’ll love this job if you...

…are a self-directed individual who operates with passion, urgency, focus, and discipline… put simply, you get-stuff-done.
…have problem solving skills that are unparalleled…you are scrappy and resourceful
…are an adaptable team player. You will enthusiastically take on other assignments as needed to support your team!
…are detailed-oriented with a knack for precision and accuracy in numbers and analyses.
…are someone who appreciates diversity in all it’s forms
…are someone who appreciates a company that values and encourages work-life balance

We’ve got you covered…

Our employees are our most important asset and that’s reflected in our benefits. Nordstrom is proud to offer a variety of benefits to support employees and their families, including:

Medical/Vision, Dental, Retirement and Paid Time Away
Life Insurance and Disability
Merchandise Discount and EAP Resources

A few more important points...

The job posting highlights the most critical responsibilities and requirements of the job. It’s not all-inclusive. There may be additional duties, responsibilities and qualifications for this job.

Nordstrom will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.

Applicants with disabilities who require assistance or accommodation should contact the nearest Nordstrom location, which can be identified at www.nordstrom.com.

Job ID: 13219
Location: Bellevue College
Full/Part Time: Full Time
Regular/Temporary: Regular

Position Summary

The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for advancing Bellevue College's use of dashboards and data visualization to support data-informed decision-making by designing and publishing data visualizations and dashboards across the College. Beyond having an operational understanding of the data used for dashboard development, they serve as the designated financial data specialist for Effectiveness, Research & Analytics, providing an understanding of financial and operations information, informed by trusted relationships with subject matter experts in Administrative Services. Additionally, they extract and curate data across data sources both internal and external and analyze that data in to support institutional and departmental evaluation and planning.

To be successful, the Business Intelligence Analyst will be analytical, collaborative, and organized. They will work in close partnership with the Data Services Manager as well as colleagues across various operational divisions to understand, prepare, and share relevant and meaningful information.

Pay, Benefits & Work Schedule

Position Salary Range: $73,539/year - $106,632/year

The salary information shown above is a general guideline only. The salary will be determined based on candidate's qualifications and related experience, as well as market and business considerations. Typically, new hire starts no higher than $81,812/year based on Bellevue College Exempt salary schedule.

We offer comprehensive compensation package with salary and benefits as the main components. Generous benefits package is offered through Washington State plans that includes multiple medical, dental, life and disability coverage choices for employees and dependents; choices of retirement and deferred compensation plans; paid holidays, sick, and vacation plans; transit program, reduced tuition, employee discounts and memberships, etc.

The employee is scheduled to work 40 hours per workweek. This position is exempt from the overtime provisions of the Fair Labor Standards Act, which means that you are not eligible for overtime pay.

About The College

Bellevue College is a diverse student-centered, comprehensive and innovative college, committed to teaching excellence that advances the life-long educational development of its students while strengthening the economic, social and cultural life of its diverse community. Bellevue College is located just 10 miles east of Seattle where we serve a student population of over 54% students of color and over 1,300 international students. The college promotes student success by providing high-quality, flexible, accessible educational programs and services; advancing pluralism, inclusion and global awareness; and acting as a catalyst and collaborator for a vibrant region.

We strive to create a vibrant and inclusive campus community that supports a diverse student body, faculty and staff. As an essential part of our mission and goals , diversity, equity and pluralism are promoted and fostered in all aspects of college life. By enriching student life through leadership opportunities, personal learning and cultural experiences, we are committed to building an inclusive and diverse campus community that fosters creativity, innovation and student success.

For more information, visit BC Facts at a Glance @ Bellevue College .

About the Department

The Office of Effectiveness, Research & Analytics is the source of official college information in support of institutional knowledge management and effectiveness. The Effectiveness, Research & Analytics supports the college's commitment to student success through strategic planning, research,and institutional continuous improvement efforts.

For more information, visit: Effectiveness, Research & Analytics at Bellevue College

Essential Functions

Dashboard Development and Education

Establish and document standards for consistent information presentation across dashboards.
Collaborate with the Data Services Manager to establish reliable data sources for dashboard development.
Develop engaging and meaningful dashboards across all functional areas that answer common questions and tell valuable data stories.
Provide group and individualized educational opportunities to better understand, interpret, and interact with published dashboards.
Financial and Operational Data Investigation, Curation, and Documentation

Build relationships with subject matter experts in Administrative Services to understand and be able to serve as the cross-functional specialist in operational data from those areas.
Partner with the Data Services Manager to construct and document curated queries and tables of operational data across systems.
Support efforts to ensure data quality and integrity by investigating unusual data trends and informing data stewards of inaccuracies.
Ad Hoc Operational Data Requests

Provide timely responses to data requests for finance and operations data, including redirecting or including representatives from relevant offices as appropriate.
Maintain documentation of responses to data requests to aid future efforts and inform the development of future dashboards.
External Reporting of Operational Data

Support efforts to provide and/or validate operational data for governmental reporting, such as Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System (IPEDS).
Collaborate with the Grants Office and others involved in external partnerships and agreements to ensure reasonableness and feasibility of operational data sharing and compliance with such agreements.
Economic and Employment Trends Research

Support academic programmatic review and development efforts by accessing, analyzing, and summarizing employment trends for associated disciplines.
Extract relevant data from external sources related to college initiatives or needs as beneficial or required.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor's degree. Any combination of relevant education and/or experience may be substituted for the educational requirement on a year-for-year basis.
At least two (2) years of experience constructing dashboards using data visualization software (such as Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Experience working with budget and finance data.
Demonstrated experience using SQL programming language and programming in SQL Server including relational databases.
Demonstrated commitment and ability to address the use of data in evaluating and addressing inequities.
Demonstrated experience establishing and maintaining cross-functional partnerships.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel.
Experience accessing and interpreting external data sources (such as IPEDS, Bureau of Labor Statistics, Lightcast, National Student Clearinghouse, etc.)
Effective written, verbal, interpersonal, and communication skills.
Demonstrated experience working with diverse colleagues and/or students in a collaborative and inclusive environment.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience working in an educational context.
Demonstrated knowledge of descriptive and inferential statistics.
Experience with Tableau development and Tableau Server.
Experience with data integrations and Application Programming Interfaces (APIs).
Experience navigating large relational databases such as student information systems (SISs) or enterprise resource platforms (ERPs).

Conditions of Employment

Bellevue College intends to provide a drug-free, healthy, safe, and secure work and educational environment. Each employee is expected to report to work in an appropriate mental and physical condition to perform her/his/their assigned duties.

Bellevue College employs only U.S. citizens and lawfully authorized non-U.S. citizens. All new employees must show employment eligibility verification as required by the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services.

Bellevue College requires all employees must be fully vaccinated and your vaccine status will be verified upon hire. Please reach out to the HR Office at jobs@bellevuecollege.edu if you need information on medical or religious accommodation.

Sexual Misconduct and Background Check:
Prior to start of employment, finalists(s) for this position will be subject to a pre-employment background check as a condition of employment. Information from the background check will not necessarily preclude employment, but will be considered in determining the applicant's suitability and competence to perform in the position.

Applicants considered for this position will be required to disclose if they are the subject of any substantiated findings or current investigations related to sexual misconduct at their current employment and past employment. Disclosure is required under Washington State Law .

Check frequently in your inbox, spam, junk, clutter email folders for any communication regarding the next steps from Bellevue College and our background check partners.

Reference Check:
Reference checks may include, but are not limited to, contacting references and verification of work experience, and/or past job duties.

Other Information

This position is NOT eligible for relocation allowance.
This position is NOT eligible for sponsorship for employment-based visa.

If you have questions with regards to the application or the hiring process, please contact Office of Human Resources at 425-564-2274 or email to jobs@bellevuecollege.edu .

EEO Statement

Seattle University will be one of the most innovative and progressive Jesuit and Catholic universities in the world, educating with excellence at the undergraduate, graduate, and professional levels. We embrace an intersectional framework for defining diversity in its broadest sense, including differences in gender, gender identity, race, ethnicity, generational history, culture, socioeconomic class, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship status, political perspectives, geographic origin and physical ability. Seattle University strives to be a welcome, open and safe campus climate for all who learn, live and work at Seattle University.

Position Description

The University Advancement Office is committed to creating an anti-racist environment that addresses and works to eliminate inequities and all forms of oppression, while celebrating different cultures. We believe the power of diversity enriches all of us by exposing us to a range of ways to understand and engage with the world, identify challenges, and to discover, design, and deliver solutions.

We are looking for team members from diverse backgrounds who demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the complex issues surrounding implicit bias and other systemic oppressions, as well as a commitment to the university’s mission, vision, and values, with the goal of developing an equitable and inclusive work environment.

Purpose:

Reporting to the Assistant Director, Advancement Data and Systems, the Advancement Data and Systems Analyst supports the alumni and donor data needs for University Advancement. The Advancement Data and Systems Analyst creates, maintains, and distributes statistical and analytical reports on all fundraising and constituent management activities. Under the direction of the Assistant Director, the Data and Systems Analyst coordinates the data request process for university partners to ensure the accurate and timely delivery of information to serve the fundraising and engagement goals of the university.

Primary Job Functions:

Designs, builds, and presents complex reports and communication lists, serving as the primary contact for data and reporting requests from university partners.
Coordinates assignments, deadlines, and priorities with Advancement Data and Systems Specialist.
Develops analytical reports and business intelligence dashboards in service of University Advancement partners’ strategic planning (Annual Giving, Office of Alumni Engagement, Advancement Events, etc.).
Serves on the Advancement Services Business Intelligence Committee and assists with the development of business intelligence solutions, visualizations, and reports.
Trains University Advancement staff on alumni and donor database software and departmental policies.
Evaluates data processing procedures for information management within the alumni and donor database, recommending changes when necessary.
Reviews and recommends best practices for advancement data and business solution documentation.
Interprets and evaluates systems and processes and provides recommendations for University Advancement policies and procedures to maximize efficiencies.
Takes on additional special projects as directed.

Additional Job Functions:

Staff working groups for university systems using alumni data (Redhawk Landing, Eventbrite).
Consults with university partners and outside vendors to determine needs and specifications on special projects.
Identifies data cleanup projects.

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent technical training and work experience required.
Four or more years of relevant work experience with relational databases including query and report writing.
Excellent computer skills, particularly with MS Office products.
Attention to accuracy/detail and willingness to problem-solve.
Strong time management and organizational skills; ability to manage multiple projects with strict deadlines.
Ability to work independently as well as establish and maintain professional relations with other staff, faculty, students, alumni, and donors.
Effective communicator both verbally and in writing with diverse audiences including both technical and non-technical personnel.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience using Raiser’s Edge or similar fundraising software.
Experience using Power BI, Tableau, or similar data visualization software.
Experience in a higher education or non-profit/fundraising setting

University Advancement is committed to developing an equitable and inclusive culture that fosters a sense of belonging for all.

Application Instructions

Please attach a cover letter with your resume when applying. Job postings are open until filled, unless otherwise specified.

Compensation at a Glance:

Salary Range: $60,000 - $64,000

Seattle University has provided a compensation range that represents its good faith estimate of what the University may pay for the position at the time of posting. The salary offered to the selected candidate will be determined based on factors such as the qualifications of the selected candidate, departmental budget availability, internal salary equity considerations, and available market information, and not based on a candidate’s gender or any other protected status.

Your total compensation goes beyond the number on your paycheck. Seattle University provides generous leave, health plans, and retirement contributions that add to your total compensation package.

Benefits at a Glance:

Consistent with its fundamental Jesuit values, Seattle University offers a wide range of benefits designed to care for the whole person. Choose from three different medical plans, a dental, and vision insurance programs. Protect your income with life, short & long-term disability coverage. Plan for your future with up to a 10% employer contribution for retirement benefits, comprised of a 5% nonelective employer contribution and an additional dollar-for-dollar match of your voluntary contributions up to a maximum of 5%. You may also take advantage of 100% paid tuition benefits for the employee and dependents, a subsidized transportation benefit, a wellness program with free access to an onsite fitness facility, and a wide variety of campus events. Enjoy a generous holiday schedule, including a paid Holiday break closure in December, vacation and paid sick leave, and paid community service leave. For more information explore the Benefits website at: https://www.seattleu.edu/hr/benefits/

Company Name: State of Washington Administrative Office of the Courts
Job Description:
Description

These positions support multiple court programs in the Court Business Office (CBO) within the Court Services Division (CSD). These positions elicit business requirements, provide expert systems analysis services, and assist with quality assurance for statewide systems that support all levels of Washington courts.

Under the general guidance and direction of a Court Business Supervisor in the Court Services Division, the Business Analyst works closely with many other business and technical staff at AOC and partner agencies, and with judicial officers, county and municipal clerks, court administrators, and other court personnel to elicit and document requirements that support application development, modification, configuration, and testing. These positions work independently under general supervision. Decision-making is carried out according to general guidelines and defined rules/procedures, although some areas require interpretation and/or development of possible approaches.

Washington Courts Employment Opportunity
Administrative Office of the Courts

Business Analyst
(Multiple Vacancies – Project & Grant Positions)
Court Business Office
Court Services Division

Our Mission: Advance the efficient and effective operation of the Washington Judicial System.

The Administrative Office of the Courts (AOC) is looking for top-performing employees who embody its core values of integrity, service excellence, visionary leadership, collaboration, and teamwork. It is committed to both employee growth and work-life balance.

Our diversity and inclusion efforts include embracing different cultures, backgrounds, and perspectives while fostering growth and advancement in the workplace.

POSITION DETAILS

Job #: 2023-31
Status: Regular, Full-Time*
Location: Olympia, Washington
Salary: Range 68C: $80,952 - $101,052 per year (DOQ)
Opens: April 12, 2023
Closes: Open Until Filled. Candidates are encouraged to apply early. AOC reserves the right to close the recruitment at any time.

Information: This recruitment is being used to fill multiple vacancies for Project & Grant positions. Please see the supplemental questions for more information on length of funding. Additional funding is dependent on approved future legislation.

COVID AND WASHINGTON STATE RESIDENCY INFORMATION

The Administrative Office of the Courts closely monitors COVID-19 pandemic updates and follows the state’s health and safety recommendations for the community and our employees. We will be conducting our recruitment process remotely.

AOC requires employees to reside in Washington State. Any exceptions must be approved. If you are invited to interview and currently reside outside of Washington State, seek more information about residency requirements from the AOC hiring manager of this recruitment.

Position may be eligible for teleworking; there may be instances requiring work in-office.

All AOC employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Please note that employment is contingent upon the candidate providing verification of their COVID vaccination status, or having an AOC-approved medical and/or religious accommodation.

Duties

Plan, schedule and lead the management of requirements for complex solutions.
Elicit business requirements from internal and external subject matter experts.
Serve as a liaison between stakeholders and technical personnel to ensure that business needs are clearly defined, understood and translated into technical solutions.
Translate business requirements into user stories, use cases and acceptance criteria.
Develop and maintain requirements documentation.
Develop and maintain requirements traceability matrices for requirement management and re-use.
Analyze requirements for completeness and testability.
Review test results to confirm that test acceptance criteria have been met.
Provide consultation to project stakeholders.
Conduct intensive, in-depth systems analysis for new or enhancements for small to large and highly complex applications and systems.
Carries out analysis, review and interpretation of existing case management system reports, makes recommendations for enhancements of existing reports and creation of new reports to assist the courts.
Recommends enhancements to court business processes.
Performs research that includes source document and accounting report analyses, business process review, including steps to reproduce results in the process of identifying issues and initiating resolution.
Plan, schedule, and lead the management of requirements for complex solutions.
Engage with stakeholders to obtain a full understanding of scope, business needs, processes, and expectations to meet objectives.
Analyze data for data quality and data reporting purposes.
Research and perform in-depth analysis for small to large and highly complex applications and systems.
Develop and maintain business requirement documentation.
Translate business requirements into user stories, use cases, and acceptance criteria.
Serve as a liaison between stakeholders and technical personnel to ensure that business needs are clearly defined, understood, and translated into technical solutions.
Develop and maintain requirements traceability matrices for requirement management and re-use.
Review test results to confirm that test acceptance criteria have been met.
Provide consultation to project stakeholders.

Qualifications

Eight years of information technology experience which includes three years of direct experience as a business analyst and/or court user subject matter expert performing business analysis functions such as conducting requirements gathering activities with stakeholders, analyzing and evaluating business functions/processes for deficiencies and enhancements, and recommending solutions to address business needs.


OR



Master's degree in computer science, information systems or related technical/business discipline with one year of direct experience as a business analyst and/or court user subject matter expert performing business analysis functions such as conducting requirements gathering activities with stakeholders, analyzing and evaluating business functions/processes for deficiencies and enhancements, and recommending solutions to address business needs.


OR



Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems or related technical/business discipline and four years of information technology experience including direct experience as a business analyst and/or court user subject matter expert performing business analysis functions such as conducting requirements gathering activities with stakeholders, analyzing and evaluating business functions/processes for deficiencies and enhancements, and recommending solutions to address business needs.


OR



Associate’s degree in computer science, information systems or related technical/business discipline and six years of information technology experience including direct experience as a business analyst and/or court user subject matter expert performing business analysis functions such as conducting requirements gathering activities with stakeholders, analyzing and evaluating business functions/processes for deficiencies and enhancements, and recommending solutions to address business needs.


Relative IT Experience includes systems and software requirements development and management, software or systems development following the software development lifecycle and project management practices.

THE IDEAL APPLICANT WILL ALSO HAVE SOME OR ALL OF THE FOLLOWING EXPERIENCE, EDUCATION, KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES


Ability to identify and analyze patterns, trends, and root causes in data sets.
Ability to understand data schemas, data models, data reporting, and data platforms.
Experience using database platforms such as SQL to perform work duties, run reports, create data queries, and analyze data.
Clear and effective written and verbal communication skills.
High comfort level working with remote communication tools (e.g., Zoom, GoToMeeting, and Microsoft Teams).
Excellent interpersonal skills, including patience, diplomacy, and ability to negotiate.
Ability to prioritize effectively, demonstrate excellent time management skills, and coordinate with team members.
Ability to multi-task and meet urgent deadlines while maintaining regular responsibilities and workload.

Supplemental Information

IMPORTANT INFORMATION


The workweek may fluctuate depending on workload or agency needs.
Overnight travel may be required based on business needs.
This position is not covered under the overtime provisions of the Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA).
The AOC is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate based on gender, pregnancy, race, color, national origin, ancestry, religion, creed, physical, mental or sensory disability (actual or perceived), use of a service animal, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, age, HIV or Hepatitis C status, or any other basis protected by federal or state law. Persons of disability needing assistance in the application process, or those needing this announcement in an alternative format, please contact the AOC Human Resource Office, at (360) 704-4143, or fax (360) 586-4409, or via email to Recruitment@courts.wa.gov.

In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire.

As an IT Data Warehouse Analyst, you will be part of a cross-functional team involved in data and analytics who apply their passion for technology to solving real-world problems. You will use your creativity and analytical skills to affect change in a global industry, working within a cross-functional, agile-oriented team performing source system analyses, establishing business/data requirements and documentation, developing process flow models and other data-related deliverables, and ensuring client needs are considered throughout the data journey and lifecycle. Engaging regularly with both internal stakeholders and external clients, you will leverage active listening and problem-solving skills to improve processes, software, and technology solutions, ultimately delivering value by solving complex business problems for clients worldwide.

Engaging with clients, internal stakeholders, and the technical community via workshops, meetings, interviews, etc., to capture technical requirements and specifications.
Identify and document source systems, data structures, and data quality issues.
Define data mapping and transformation rules to ensure data accuracy and relevance.
Integrate data from various sources into the data warehouse, ensuring data quality and consistency.
Develop data dictionaries and other metadata.
Work closely with data engineers and data analysts to ensure data extraction and transformation align with business needs.
Develop and execute data validation and quality assurance processes to ensure data integrity.
Participate in the design and implementation of data governance policies and procedures.
Serving as a primary contact point for questions related to how a product, solution, or technology supports or enables work activities in a business process.
Engaging with clients, internal stakeholders, and technical SMEs to define the business rules that products and solutions need to support.
Leveraging systems analysis models and diagrams such as activity diagrams, entity-relationship diagrams, etc. to solve problems.
Developing specifications, diagrams, data mappings, flowcharts, and other artifacts for engineering teams.
Recommending changes to existing solutions, platforms, and products, identifying impacted interfaces, and working with technical teams to implement and test changes.
Verifying if software, products, and/or services meet client and organizational needs and goals.
Working as a willing and valued team member accountable for achieving OKRs that drive Carrix and client success.
Create and manage against OKRs.
Other duties as assigned.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent work experience preferred.
2+ years' work experience in an analytical or software development capacity, or equivalent experience.
Proficiency in SQL, ETL, and data analysis tools.
Experience with data visualization tools (i.e., Power BI).
Experience with agile software development methodologies preferred.
Experience with business process re-engineering concepts and methods preferred.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Deep knowledge of data mapping/journey analysis and documentation methods.
Ability to translate business requirements into technical specifications.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (i.e., SQL, Python, etc.).
Proficiency with data integration techniques and tools.
Understanding of data modeling and database design.
Experience with data visualization tools.
Understanding of data security practices and the ability to ensure data protection and compliance.
Deep knowledge of project management methodologies and best practices.
Deep knowledge of the Microsoft Office Suite (e.g., Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
Proven ability to work in a dynamic, varied, and fast-paced environment.
Proven ability to adapt quickly to new technologies and changing business requirements.
Proven ability to leverage leading problem-solving skills to solve complex problems.
Proven ability to apply leading communication skills to present technical information in a concise manner to various stakeholders, verbally and in writing.
Proven ability to apply project management skills to prioritize and multitask.
Ability to apply active listening and collaboration skills to effectively engage both technical and non-technical stakeholders to achieve target outcomes.
Ability to quickly learn the objectives, structures, operations, and policies of a business area.
Ability to influence others using leading analytical & storytelling skills.
Ability to negotiate and resolve conflicts.
Ability to be flexible, adaptable, pragmatic, and committed.

Supervisory Responsibilities: No

Work Environment:

Required job duties are normally performed in a climate-controlled office environment.
Exposure to computer screens.
The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

Company Name: County of Grant Public Utility District2
Job Description:
Closing Date to Apply: December 21, 2023

Salary: $70,096.00 to $107,972.80

Typically, selected candidates are hired at a salary rate between the minimum and midpoint of the range.

Benefits: This link below will provide you with Grant PUD’s benefit that may be available if hired, different employee types are eligible for different benefits.

Grant PUD — Unified Insurance Program (uip-wa.org)

Grant County PUD will administer a background check as part of the hiring process.

Position Summary

Responsible for understanding all the financial aspects of the District – O&M, capital, and labor. Provide a variety of analysis and reports to the operating unit’s management and program managers as well as working closely with Finance. Identifies business improvement opportunities and works with the respective management to implement such.

The position is also responsible for supporting the development and management of the District’s Capital Plan in conjunction with the Manger of Budget & Reporting.

Essential Functions

Essential functions, as defined under the Americans with Disabilities Act, may include any of the following representative duties, knowledge, and skills. This is not a comprehensive listing of all functions and duties performed by incumbents of this class; employees may be assigned duties which are not listed below; reasonable accommodations will be made as required. The job description does not constitute an employment agreement and is subject to change at any time by the employer. Essential duties and responsibilities may include, but are not limited to, the following:

Develops and implements data driven decisions and strategies for department / division.
Consult with Supervisors and Project Managers within assigned organizations to use analytical and reporting tools to develop effective cost, quality, and satisfaction outcomes. This includes leading assigned organizational efforts in the areas of MBR's, budget development/management, and KPI's as needed.
Provides oversight for the content, format, and production of regular and ad hoc reports.
Participates in and may facilitate work groups and committees.
May assist with limited project management, interpretations, and recommendations.
Accountable for achieving accurate and reliable data and reports for budgeting and actual reporting.
Champion the development and maintenance of processes that maximize efficiency and are as consolidated as business dictates to create a streamlined process for budgeting for capital, O&M and labor.
Strive to automate and standardized reports as much as practical.
Analysis will include basic mathematical functions such as addition, subtraction, calculating percentages to more complex functions such as trending data and reviewing for anomalies.
Train and or mentor employees within the CFO functional area as identified by the position and requested by individuals.
Support the implementation of a financial improvement effort designed to achieve internal performance goals and meet all regulatory requirements.
In collaboration with the Manager of Budget & Reporting, will be accountable for ensuring accurate financial data and reporting is available and is an integral part of decision-making processes.
Develops and maintains assigned areas’ functional area budgeting and reporting process in coordination with other staff and is accountable for overseeing implementation of such process and reporting of implementation status to the Manager of Budget & Reporting.
Effectively leads individuals or groups of individuals in the training, implementation and monitoring of the budgeting and reporting process to achieve internal goals and performance.
Is accountable for the implementation of a comprehensive multi-year effort to enhance budgeting and financial reporting and performance through an improved budgeting and reporting process that includes effective administrative controls and processes, and increased accountability at all levels of the organization.
Supports the implementation of budgeting development and reporting continuous improvement processes that are initiated, managed, and implemented via cross-sectional, employee-based working groups as necessary.
Identifies and develops a range of financial based trainings for employees, foremen, supervisors, managers, and executive leadership.
Maintains consistent and proactive awareness of current regulations related to accounting and bond compliance regulations as well as best industry practices.
Develops relationships with Finance to develop consistent data requests, reporting requirements and timelines.
Provides counsel and recommendation to management and staff.
Is accountable for overseeing the development of quantitative budgeting and financial performance metrics based on leading and lagging indicators including the regular compilation, analysis, and reporting of relevant data relative to established goals and objectives.
Provides updates to the Manager of Budget & Reporting on the status of programs, initiatives, plans, and reports.
Effectively communicates goals, priorities, potential future initiatives, and performance to the Manager of Budget & Reporting.
Ensures all safety-training is completed as requested. In addition, follows all safety-related policies and procedures.
Proactively participates in company-wide initiatives as requested or approved by the Manager of Budget & Reporting.
Develops professional and effective relationships at all levels of organization focusing on management within assigned functional areas and its managers within.
Maintains a high level of confidentiality regarding personnel issues and sensitive operational infromation.
Compose correspondence and develop reports and or proposals when needed or requested.
Assume other activities and responsibilities as directed.
Demonstrated commitment to Grant PUD’s mission, vision, values, strategic plan, and Grant PUD / IBEW Local 77 Code of Excellence. The incumbent should be familiar with these organizational priorities and behave in a way that aligns with these expectations.
Understand and adhere to compliance requirements for this position that may include laws, regulations, security guidelines, Grant PUD policies & procedures.
Actively participate in all aspects of our safety program, including but not limited to:
Following all safety policies and produces.
Alerting supervisors and coworkers to unsafe or hazardous working conditions.
Reporting any safety incidents or close calls within 24 hours to your supervisor.
Accepting feedback from supervisors and coworkers regarding your own safety performance.

Education and Experience

Required

High School diploma or GED.
Minimum of four (4) year degree in Business Administration, Accounting, Finance, or related field.
Requires three to four years of analytical, data management and reporting, computer/ programming and or business experience.

Preferred

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Finance, or related field desired.
Three (3) years of job related experience may be substituted for formal higher education.
Four (4) to five (5) years of experience specifically in the utility industry.

Licenses and Certifications

Required

A valid State driver’s with no restrictions.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

Knowledge

Perform sound mathematical skills and financial/budgeting reporting.
General knowledge of District’s Strategic Plan, policies, and procedures.
Thorough knowledge of budget preparation and reporting processes.
Thorough working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Access, Project, PowerPoint), File360, Maximo, and SSRS. Knowledge of Excel includes the working ability to use pivot tables. Basic knowledge of SharePoint and Microsoft Project including the ability to read and interpret schedules.
General knowledge of District phone systems and it’s functionality.
General knowledge of office administration principles and concepts.
General knowledge of business and public administration principles. Knowledge of public utility processes desired.
Demonstrated knowledge of personal computer skills that include word processing and spreadsheet; mainframe computer skills such as inquiry, data entry, and printer operation skills.
General knowledge of electric utilities including electric transmission and distribution systems and it'd functionality.
Knowledge of organizational behavior and change management and concepts.
Understand the financial aspects of the utility industry and specifically financial concepts such as return-on- investment and risk adjusted internal rate of return.
Business acumen and strong analytical skills with a strong knowledge of data analysis and risk assessment.

Skills

Develop reports, analyze’s processes, and identify and implement efficiency improvements.
Develop and maintain relationships with individuals across the utility for the purpose of clarifying expectations and processes, requesting data, exchanging information, obtaining approvals, negotiating agreements, coordinating schedules, presenting findings and reporting conclusions.
Deliver technical and non-technical presentations, and speak professionally and effectively before a wide range of audiences.
Research, analyze, understand and apply diversified and complex calculations to often-changing data or reporting and analysis requests.
Communicate and coordinate with all departments pertaining to budgeting and reporting needs, processes, performance, etc.
Conduct comprehensive audits of data.
Develop and track performance metrics.

Abilities

Ability to organize and manage multiple functions realizing a high level of efficient work processes.
Ability to use personal judgment, direction, tact, courtesy, and patience.
Ability to function effectively and coordinate/prioritize a variety of tasks and assignments simultaneously.
Ability to research and abstract information and supporting data in preparation for meetings, work projects and reports.
Ability to work alone and in groups of diverse audiences.
Ability to maintain a high level of professionalism and maintain composure even under stressful circumstances.
Ability to work effectively with others and have good interpersonal skills.
Ability to communicate effectively in oral and written form.
Demonstrated skill and ability in planning, report writing, coordinating, and administrating.
Demonstrated ability to solve problems and make sound decisions within defined levels of authority.
Demonstrated ability to get programs moving and accomplish same while working in a coordinated manner with all other departments.
Demonstrated abilities in leadership, adaptability, flexibility, and conflict resolution.
Maintain a high standard of ethical behavior in business activities and decisions.
Work independently in completing assigned projects, routine tasks, and critical deadlines on time.
Ability to think strategically.
Superior communication skills and the ability to influence people.
Basic understanding of management styles and team building.
Strong team player with passion, drive, and the ability to be a self-starter.
Participation in technical, professional, and community activities.
Must be self-motivated, organized, and able to work under pressure meeting deadlines.

Physical Requirements

Position may be eligible for hybrid work arrangement: Yes
No
Per Grant County PUD policy all employees are required to work at their designated headquarters at least two days per week.
The duties of this position are primarily performed in an office environment with occasional exposure to noise and vibrating work. Must be able to drive to and visit actual work sites , meetings and other District Offices to include: exposure to heat and cold, humidity and air quality conditions, exposure to heavy equipment and maintenance work areas of Hydro Facilities, climbing stairs, periodically walk, stand, bend, lift and carry items up to 30 pounds, requires sitting for long periods of time and working in front of a computer, must have good hearing and listening abilities, speak clearly and able to work in hazardous work zones.
Typical shift of employees in this position: 8 hours 9 hours 10 hours
12 hours

Standard Title: Business Analyst (Building Data Systems)

Location: United States Non-Specific Location (100% remote)

Job Type: Business Analyst, Program Specialist with Building Data System Experience

Summary of the Role

The Business Analyst (BA) will collaborate with our enterprise clients worldwide sustainability team and other businesses to gather, document, and inspect building datasets in accordance with our enterprise clients standards. The BA will help implement existing processes and workflows and suggest new processes to improve information and data flow across the organizations. The BA will help identify data errors, data gaps and conduct tests to ensure datasets are complete and accurate and provide recommendations to enhance operational efficiency and effectiveness.

Responsibilities

Work at the direction of our client and engage with other business units around the use and operation of buildings and services provided at buildings (e.g., utilities and waste).
Develop ongoing mechanisms for data management and validations
Collaborate with worldwide sustainable client to ensure building datasets and information meet data standards and initiate reconciliation steps with the data owners to ensure they get resolved in a timely manner.
Created detailed documentation related to building datasets and/or workflows to ensure all data sources, data transformations and processes are documented to the level needed.
Update project management tools on progress, challenges and completed tasks.
Participate in data validations and quality control activities produced by clients Business Intelligence Engineers (BIEs).
Data reconciliation to data sources for verification and accuracy.
Perform miscellaneous tasks as assigned.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, or 3 years of Business Analyst work experience.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical-thinking skills.
Proven experience as a Business Analyst or similar experience in a related role
Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Familiarity with project management tools and concepts.

Preferred Qualifications

Familiarity with Amazon building tools or other experience working on building information and data.

Why Join Us? At Connections, we believe in compassionate, naturalistic intervention approaches that focus on building independence and increasing quality of life. We believe that all children are unique individuals that deserve the opportunity to learn at their own pace and toward their own tailored goals. Since school is where many students spend the majority of their day, we believe that building capacity in these settings to work with students of all abilities and diagnosis will make the greatest impact on our students as they move through childhood and into adolescence. As a School-Based BCBA, you'll be part of a team that values fun, compassionate, research-based intervention that will allow our students to access all that their environment has to offer.

Primary Purpose: As a School-Based BCBA, you will be providing behavior intervention and support for students ages 3-21 in the school setting. This setting will provide you with the opportunity to work with teachers and administrators with a focus on stabilization and building capacity within our school districts. You will also have the opportunity to provide ongoing supervision and support for our Registered Behavior Technicians, conduct FBAs/FAs, and create behavior plans. Our ultimate goal is always to empower students and teachers by giving them the tools they need for success and systematically fade our supports.

Job Responsibilities:

Conducting client intakes: reviewing client documents, interviewing school team, client observation, administering behavior assessments
Creating individualized behavior intervention plans which include FBA results, behavioral objectives, replacement behaviors, antecedent strategies, and fade plans
Creating skill acquisition programs for replacement behaviors and supporting documents for behavior plans
Completing monthly progress reports
Analyze data and implement/adjust interventions
Conduct FBAs, FAs, indirect assessments, and criterion-based assessments as needed
Supervise RBT’s working with directly clients
Provide feedback and ongoing training to RBTs
Provide training to stakeholders
Coordinate care with other school professionals, teachers, and medical providers
Create plans for fading RBT support, generalization, and maintenance

Overview:

Morgan Advanced Materials is a business rich in history and innovation. Founded in the UK in 1856, we have grown into a global organisation with 70 sites in 18 countries. Our model to serve our customers where they need us has led to a diversified product range using our unparalleled expertise in ceramic and carbon materials, which we exploit to solve difficult problems for our customers across a diverse range of markets.


We are a purpose driven organisation. Our purpose is to use advanced materials to make the world more sustainable and to improve the quality of life. We deliver on that purpose through the products that we make, and the way that we make them.


We help our customers push the limits of their processes and products to meet the demanding requirements they face, from higher process temperatures to higher product performance to increasing miniaturisation.

Key Figures: Revenue £1,112m (2022), ~8,500 employees, manufacturing in 30+ countries, and a global customer portfolio. A UK PLC with head office located in Windsor, Berkshire UK. Listed on London Stock Exchange; Member of the FTSE 250 Index.


Responsibilities:

OVERVIEW & SCOPE OF ROLE:

Morgan IT is on a mission to enable and drive the Morgan goals by being a valuable business partner to all Global Business Units and Functions by:

Running Effective and Efficient IT
Delivering Solid Business Foundations
Extracting Maximum Business Value from IT
Driving disruptive innovation

To do so, the OneIT team is currently executing on a strategic roadmap to make significant step changes in IT performance and business value from IT.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES & REPONSIBILITIES:
The D365 IT Business Analyst will ensure the line of business applications, primarily Dynamics 365 (D365), can sustain current and future business needs for our businesses. This role is responsible for providing D365 technical and functional expertise, ensuring business requirements are gathered and subsequent technical/functional resolutions are implemented appropriately. In addition, the role will ensure efficient and effective business as usual operation of D365, including remediation of issues.

The D365 IT Business Analyst understands both technology as well as business and is responsible to capture all business requirements in order to ensure proper IT solutions are delivered. The key focus is mapping functional requirements of the Finance & Supply Chain modules in D365, data and processes.
Key Accountabilities
Serves as liaison to business and IT teams to understand business requirements and create and implement solutions as well as understanding root causes of current issues.
Assembling business requirements with requisite analysis and translation into D365 solutions; along with alternative options and recommendations.
Supports designing business solutions that ensure alignment with the architecture principles and standards.
Documents and provides training for newly implemented systems and/or processes using Click Learn
Resolving incidents/issues, with root cause analysis and fix where appropriate, for D365 applications.
Applying functional and technical understanding of D365 to develop new functionality and integrations/interfaces with other systems as required, to support business growth.
Ensuring all aspects of the D365 development lifecycle are completed successfully, incorporating ISV solutions.
Assuring quality of releases (fixes/upgrades/enhancements etc) into production, through thorough testing and first-class environment management.
Ensuring vendor relationships remain transparent and with clearly understood outcomes
Supports Business Information Managers, Project Managers and Solution Architects in writing program / project proposals
Work with business end users to ensure the project meets business needs
Assumes ownership of the process, system, and expands skill base.
Interacts frequently with business process owners.
Conduct unit testing for project deliverables and facilitate user acceptance testing
Engage in efforts to establish scope and business case for new programs and initiatives.
Collaborate with team members to collect and analyse data

Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the third largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in fourteen countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco ranks seventh in Forbes “World’s Best Employers”.

This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others.

Come join the Costco Wholesale IT family. Costco IT is a dynamic, fast-paced environment, working through exciting transformation efforts. We are building the next generation retail environment where you will be surrounded by dedicated and highly professional employees.

Compliance Analysts support the overarching values and business goals of Costco as they relate to meeting legal and regulatory obligations, protecting member privacy, and ensuring continued compliance. Compliance Analysts work closely with other teams to define and set corporate guidance in response to emerging standards and legislations by making certain that all policies and procedures are implemented and well documented, performing internal reviews, and identifying compliance problems that call for formal attention. Compliance Analysts speak both technical and business language interchangeably to effectively communicate and lead.

Costco is seeking a Compliance Analyst to join our team. The selected candidate will be highly motivated and talented analyst with a passion for governance, risk, and compliance. The ideal candidate will have experience supporting and managing data-driven activities in large enterprise environments. This position will work with a team to develop solutions for assuring compliance is understood, disseminated, and evangelized across the company. The role will require the applicant to have good verbal and written skills and a willingness to learn.

If you want to be a part of one of the worldwide BEST companies “to work for”, simply apply and let your career be reimagined.




ROLE

Identifies problems, analyzes data, and presents findings in a professional manner, recommends mitigations either via new technology, alternative compensating controls, or policy modifications to improve overall security posture.
Provides governance for the identification, validation, and remediation of information technology controls for any applicable regulatory compliance frameworks.
Designs IT testing procedures to identify and evaluate risk exposures and determine the effectiveness and efficiency of controls.
Maintains a strong understanding and adherence of current and upcoming standards, regulations, and legislation.
Stays current with new and evolving security topics and technologies via formal training and self-directed education.
Innovative, creative, and works well under pressure to identify and problem-solve high intensity situations with a strong sense of urgency.
Manages and communicates key compliance milestones for critical systems and complex processes.
Establishes and meets deadlines to ensure adherence to rules and regulations.
Assists and supports the organization with initial compliance with ongoing preparation, testing, and monitoring of conformance.
Audits information system activities and systems to confirm compliance and provides management with compliance assessments.
Identifies risks and evaluates findings while working with internal departments/business units to appropriately address the findings.
Aids in development of database for ingestion, normalization of multiple data sources, to enable dashboarding and reporting.
Monitors dashboards for results that indicate compliance concerns.
Coordinates across GRC to establish management-level reporting to drive compliant activities and solutioning.
Ensures database, controls, and documentation is aligned and up-to-date with regulatory requirements.
Facilitates process creation in alignment with identified compliance controls.
Reviews existing processes to ensure compliance requirements are addressed.
Ability to assist, as needed, with external and internal assessments and audits.
Identifies areas of opportunity to automate evidence collection as well as provide feedback on areas of opportunity for control streamlining.
Logs identified issues, concerns, audit findings, and exceptions into the database, along with notifying business leaders of concerns.
Works cross-function to provide feedback on process improvement.
Assesses current operations and business functions to meet minimum compliance requirements.
Assists in the development and update of IT policies and standards, ensures alignment with known regulatory requirements.
Collaborates with teams to meet updated policies, standards, controls, and/or regulatory requirements. Aids in updating existing processes to meet new requirements.
Conducts kick-off, reviews, and ongoing work efforts across the corporation. Acts as a liaison between the business and compliance to translate requirements into business objectives.
Participates in the evaluation and implementation of other new compliance solutions and technologies.

REQUIRED

1-3 years’ experience in compliance, databases, and using data-visualization tools.
Working knowledge of Information Security best practices, policies, standards, and baselines, including industry standards and guidelines from ISO 27001/27002, NIST, CIS, and OWASP.
Technical working experience/knowledge of operating systems, databases, web applications, middleware, and other computing devices/software components.
Experience in computer software or computer networking.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical-thinking skills.
Strong communication skills and attention to detail.
Recommended
Compliance and security certifications preferred (e.g., Security+, GCIA, GCIH, CISSP, CEH, CCSP, CISA, CISM, etc.).
Ability to work with cross-business and cross-functional teams in a geographically distributed environment.
Ability to work independently, as well as part of the team.
Ability to conduct root cause analysis against identified controls gaps and aid in solutioning, process creation.
Ability to examine issues both strategically and analytically.
Ability to work on multiple, simultaneous initiatives.
Bachelor’s degree in Information Security, Computer Science, or equivalent experience.
Ability to research.

Required Documents

Cover Letter
Resume

Description:

JOB SUMMARY

The Business Analyst tracks membership growth and reconciles eligibility with capitated revenue. The analyst identifies, researches, and escalates irregularities in membership trends to management. This position is a key partner in improving communication internally and with payor partners to solve eligibility related issues such as reassigning patients to a new primary care provider. The Business Analyst will work closely with the finance team and coordinate as necessary with staff in the claims, customer service, and clinical functional areas. The role helps identify the tools and specifications needed to better manage eligibility.

Requirements:

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Research, escalate and resolve problems with member eligibility and provider panel changes
Work directly with NPN contracted health plan representatives to ensure accurate eligibility and patient assignment
Support the development and maintenance of internal processes for eligibility, patient assignment/reassignment, and panel status change requests
Reconcile capitation with eligibility and claims
Track membership growth by primary care provider and practice
Critically evaluate data to detect discrepancies that may indicate data quality issues
Document system problems and resolutions for future reference
Ad-hoc analytical projects

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Commercially astute, articulate, technically strong, insightful and influential leader with the ability to operate at both strategic and operational levels
Detailed knowledge of healthcare insurance industry, contract negotiations, and IPA business model
Experience with healthcare data systems, accounting systems, Microsoft Office Suite and SharePoint
Strong Excel knowledge and experience
Basic knowledge of SQL and related technologies
Must work well in a team-centered culture
High integrity and openness combined with commitment to good governance
Skill in gathering, interpreting and analyzing complex data and reports
Skill in exercising initiative, judgement, problem solving, and decision-making
Skill in developing and maintaining effective relationships with internal staff, network practices, Board of Managers, clients, regulators, public, and all other associated stakeholders
Skill in organizing and prioritizing to achieve NPN strategic goals and objectives
Knowledge of specific communication needs with the ability to listen actively and respond to internal and external customers in a timely, competent manner both verbally and in writing
Ability to handle high levels of pressure and critical decision-making

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Education:

Bachelor’s degree in economics, finance, healthcare or related field

Experience:

5 years of relevant experience in analysis, reporting and work flow development in the healthcare industry
Working knowledge of healthcare capitation and full-risk healthcare contracts
Possesses strong analytical and problem-solving skills and the ability to investigate and analyze information and to draw logical conclusions
Experience with and aptitude for utilizing a data warehouse to obtain, analyze and summarize information
Experience with lean six-sigma preferred
