Job Title: Retail Financial Analyst, Business Analysis, and Reporting
Job Description:
Our Mission

Mud Bay’s mission is to contribute to the health of dogs and cats and the happiness of those who care for them while taking pride in our strong family and employee-owned company.

Job Summary

Our Financial Analyst ensures individuals and teams throughout Mud Bay have the data they need to make informed and effective business decisions. They are part of Mud Bay’s ecosystem of experts on labor productivity and supply chain management. The Financial Analyst works together with operations leaders on data metrics that drive Mud Bay toward optimal performance. This includes store labor optimization, supply chain management, innovation priorities, and other areas.

Responsibilities:

Analyzes data and outcomes to understand performance trends and spot opportunities for improvement.
Designs and develops financial models and analyses that support operations leaders.
Builds relationships across the company to facilitate decision-making and course corrections.
Tracks and follows up on metric outcomes that identify opportunities for change and threats to optimal performance.
Identifies the potential for process improvements to increase operational effectiveness, efficiency, and excellence.
Develops an understanding of operations through working and observing in the field and effective communication with field leaders and staff.
Works closely in and around software tools used in labor management, scheduling, and supply chain.
Collaborates with and teaches operations leaders to help utilize tools in place and understand analyses.
Stays informed of current and applicable benchmarks, trends, tools, and approaches inside and outside of the pet industry.
Participates in ad-hoc scenario analyses that could drive actionable business changes.
Collaborates on other various company projects and initiatives as needed.
Works closely with all levels and teams throughout Mud Bay.

Education, Skills, and Experience:

BA/BS degree in finance, accounting, business administration, statistics or other analytical discipline.
4+ years of full-time relevant business experience. Retail preferred but not required.
Curious, independent, inquisitive mind with a high level of attention to detail.
Strong mathematical, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
Results-oriented self-starter who can turn high-level direction into self-directed plans.
Proficient in Excel and BI tools such as Tableau.
Able to work and communicate with senior leadership.
Strong planning and organizational skills.
High level of maturity, discretion, tact, and judgment.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with various audiences throughout the organization.

Physical Requirements:

Ability to work alongside field staff to better understand their work.
Ability to work on a computer for extended periods of time.
Position Details & Travel Requirements:

Job Title: Retail Financial Analyst

Full Time
Salary: $73,456-$91,832
Reports to CFO and a member of the Finance and Accounting Team
Combines work in Mud Bay’s home office in Olympia WA with work at home, in our retail stores, our distribution center, and our service locations.
Must be able to travel to any store within the Mud Bay footprint.

Staff discount

401(k)

Responsibilities include;

Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business and program decisions
Create and execute campaigns with direct customers (dataset owners) to ensure we reach 100% adoption and compliance in time to meet our goals.
Ensure data accuracy by validating data for new and existing tools.

Learn and understand a broad range of Amazon’s data resources and know-how, when, and which to use and which not to use.

Create guidelines for dataset owners to modify dataset schema to enable fine-grained access controls.

Work closely with program stakeholders to understand, track, and iterate the business requirements and provide analyses.
Understand trends related to Amazon data access within the business teams and recommend strategies to stakeholders to help drive business growth/reduce risk.
Identify, develop, manage, and execute analyses to uncover areas of opportunity and present written business recommendations that will help shape the direction of the business.
Supporting cross-functional teams on the day-to-day execution of the access control compliance and requirement implementation.
Influencing across multiple levels of leadership and organizations through strong communication and analytical skills via Program Flashes and wiki updates.
Monitoring existent metrics, analyzing data, and partnering with program partner teams to identify process and system improvement opportunities.
Research and implement cost reduction opportunities through the program roadmap initiatives

Yrs Exp: 3-5yr


Industry Preference:

Finance
If someone is coming from security or identify varication



REQUIRED SKILLS

SQL
Be able to work in ambiguous environments
Writing/ communication: they will be leading campaigns and leadership updates
Excel- be able to complete Pivot tables, power pivots, any data visualization
Financial analysis experience

Making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders




PREFERRED SKILLS

AWS products (S3 or redshift)
Managing large complex data sources
Tableau would be great
Scripting languages (Python)

Overview:
Under general supervision, this position enhances the performance of the Maintenance Division by optimizing the performance of technology, gathering data, and making recommendations based on performance metrics. The position also designs new system processes, plans major installations to ensure successful and efficient use of technology to perform maintenance work. The Business Analyst develops reports to meet Federal, State, Local, and Department requirements.
Essential Duties:

1. Defines product roadmap and strategy, gathers stakeholder requirements, and assists with prioritization of the requirements. Develops criteria for systems, system design, testing methods, quality standards and completion dates. Works to identify and implement unused functionality as appropriate. Keeps track of technological advancements and trends.


2. Develops complex reports for the division and agency. Gathers business requirements from stakeholders to determine report and data needs. Partners with Agency Research and Analytics team to make sure the business requirements are met by agency wide reporting. Uses SQL to develop spreadsheets, reports and tools for reviewing data, troubleshooting and testing/validating source system data.


3. Consults with Agency departments to gather current and future technology requirements. Documenting processes, identifying concerns, and compiling data analysis reports. Customizes all affected systems to reflect necessary changes. Determines needed procedural changes, designs, and implements these new functionalities to improve efficiency for evolving business processes. Identifies areas where new technology can be used to make process improvements.


4 Identifies, researches, and analyzes system errors. Mentors staff in diagnosing and resolving complex software problems. Develops documentation and delivers end-user training for all systems. Maintains product backlog and leads regular prioritization with business unit owners and leadership.


5. Enables, supports, and encourages use of data in decision-making. Works closely with the Research and Analytics team to ensure that projects align with business objectives. Regularly provide presentations and guidance to internal and external groups.

Assist management with projects as needed. Such as, design process maps (utilizing Visio or similar product), creating presentations in PowerPoint, and diagnose and repair issues in existing documents. Maintain data confidentiality.


6. Performs other duties of a similar nature or level as assigned

Requirements:
Minimum Qualifications


Advanced formal knowledge such as certifications in product management, PMP, Scrum, or typically may be associated with bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems, business administration, or similar.
Three years with business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification, and methodology development.
Three years process analysis or project management experience.
Advanced knowledge of LEAN principles and tools.

** An equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the essential duties of the job such as those listed above may be considered. **

Preferred but NOT required at time of hire



1. Prior experience in the transportation industry or fleet maintenance.
2. Advanced knowledge of operations practices, workflow analysis, business systems

design, and process re-engineering.
3. Three years of experience compiling data.
4. Experience using data visualization and tracking tools (Tableau, Power BI, Smartsheet).
5. Ability to test system upgrades in “sandbox”, to include creating testing scenarios to

ensure thorough and consistent evaluation of upgrades.

Entry Knowledge Requirements


Computer operation and software utilization including Windows, Word, Excel, Tableau, Visio, PowerPoint, Outlook, and internet.
Time management and priority setting.
Record and file management systems.
Editing skills to include grammar, punctuation, spelling.
Business procedures: correspondence, record management, handling confidential or privileged records.
Principles of reporting.
Speak, read, and present ideas in English.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Entry Skill Requirements


Collaboration; Oral and written communication, making presentations before groups and committees. Communicate information and ideas in speaking or writing so others will understand.
Communication and interpersonal relations as applied to interaction with coworkers, supervisor, the key stakeholder groups, etc. sufficient to exchange or convey information and to receive work direction.
Analytical, mathematical, and creative problem-solving skills.
Exercise independent judgement and act on it.
Professional and tactful approaches when exposed to sensitive issues.
Applying an intentional focus on equity and inclusion to support an equitable and inclusive work environment.
Practice sound organizational and time management techniques to meet required timelines and goal objectives.
Working with highly detailed and confidential data.
Ability to adapt to rapidly shifting priorities.
Learning new assignments quickly.
Research and develop techniques to analyze business processes.
Use logic and reason to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions, or approaches to problem solving.
Identify complex problems, review related information, develop, and evaluate options and recommend solutions.
Task focused, gain consensus from others, work independently and in teams, in a logical, analytical, and detail-orientated manner.
Interpret and apply applicable federal, state, and local rules and regulations.

Preferred Skills and Knowledge


Community Transit’s policies and procedures.
Preventive Maintenance scheduling.
State/federal regulations regarding vehicle maintenance.
Departmental SME for administrative systems and programs such as EAM
Ability to create/generate non-standard reports within department data management systems.
Understand and practice basic asset management principles pertaining to vehicle management.
Development of Key Performance Indicators to monitor and measure performance.


Working Conditions

About Us

Tepui is a higher standard of consulting. We are a team of business process experts with a solutions approach to management, business intelligence, and data visualization. Leveraging technology to assess performance, we work with clients to identify problems and address them through analytics. Our consultants cover all aspects of BI and present meaningful insights through clear, visual storytelling so your business can thrive during market change. Tepui is the key to elevate your business.


Overview

We are looking for a talented Business Analyst - License Royalty, a high-energy, passionate, and detail-oriented analyst, with a "can do" attitude, who can think strategically in a complex and fast paced environment and quickly operationalize into tangible results. Responsible for reviewing, analyzing, and evaluating license royalties and partner needs, formulates and implement royalty reporting process improvements and assists business lead with preparation of monthly/quarterly reports and spear-heading various special projects. The Business Analyst - License Royalty need to exhibit excellent qualities in attention to detail, analytical acumen, facilitating and communication, collaboration with stakeholders and partners, and competing priority management. The ideal candidate will need to have top communication skills at interpersonal level, and in presentation to internal and external groups.


If you want to join a highly collaborative, ambitious, motivated, and fun team of consulting professionals, while seeking to challenge yourself, learn, grow your career, and work with amazing people to drive strategic business outcomes, then we want you!


Role & Responsibilities:

Perform analytical, design, testing, and managerial tasks associated with the management all the royalty processing and reporting from all licensing partners.
Become business insight and rhythm of the business subject matter expert (SME). Assess royalty and market data trends and best practices, and partner with business and strategy team to communicate findings.
Manage and processes royalty report rhythm and ensures that 100% of deadlines are met. Executes royalty budgeting and forecasting cycles. Generate forecasting reporting views for leadership team.
Using proven approaches and problem-solving techniques, identify and document license royalty reporting needs, assess alternatives and options, and develop proposals for royalty reporting process improvements.
Act as single point of contact for partners for all things related to license royalties. Be the liaison between royalty license team and multiple internal cross-functional teams.
Work independently to manage deliverables or key components of major projects — includes defining tasks, managing the work, and being accountable for the deliverable of assigned components.
Use solid judgment to determine appropriate escalation and resolution of issues within program structure.



Qualifications & Skills:

Demonstrated excellent written/oral communication skills, technical documentation skills, user liaison skills, and personal interaction abilities.
Effectively presents royalty licensing material to non-technical audiences in an approachable way.
Experience in data modeling and reporting, incl. data visualization.
Demonstrated knowledge and work experience with enterprise-wide relational databases, scripting languages, XML, SQL Server, BI reporting tools.
Ability to effectively manage multiple projects, have excellent attention to detail, and work effectively under deadlines.
Minimum of 3+ years of experience performing progressively more complex work in business analysis.
Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in Business Administration, Information Science, Computer Science or related area or experience

Job Title: Senior Salesforce Business Analyst - Remote US
Job Description:
Holland America Line has been exploring the world since 1873. Our ships offer innovative features and enriching experiences focused on destination exploration and personalized travel, inviting guests to savor the journey.

We’re looking for an amazing Senior Salesforce Business Analyst to fill this role, which can be based in our Seattle, WA or Miami, FL offices You’ll be responsible for all aspects of end-user experience, business functionality and day-to-day support for the company’s Sales Force platform. As the primary Salesforce Business Analyst, this individual will manage end-user access and system hierarchy, troubleshoot user challenges with functionality and identify issues and enhancements for actioning by IT. In addition, they will provide end-user training and materials, coordinate rollouts of new functionality, develop and maintain reports and dashboards, drive end-user adoption and foster the overall optimization of the platform. They will also be responsible for assessing and capturing key business insights that can either benefit from or be actioned within Sales Force functionality.

Here’s a summary of what Holland America Line is looking for in its Senior Salesforce Business Analyst. Is this you?

Responsibilities

Works with business leaders and IT stakeholders gathering requirements to define business needs, system requirements, and customization for implementation in Salesforce.
Provides Salesforce support to users by troubleshooting requests to gain understanding and insight into user experience. Stays up to date on new Salesforce features and functionality, providing recommendations as warranted. Reviews and provides insight on quarterly releases test appropriate functionality as directed and provides enhancement recommendations.
Supports projects from end-to-end across all phases in various categories impacting the North American sales department. Reports on key performance metrics, providing key insights into business trends and giving recommendations, and participating in decision-making for new ideas/initiatives.
Develops documentation, presentations, videos, and related content to support user adoption.
Creates and maintains Salesforce dashboards and reports to support business KPIs and leadership problem-solving.
Collaborates with Salesforce users and IT to create test cases develops test scripts, coordinates user acceptance testing, and obtains sign-off and approval.
Performs data queries and analytics Extracts data from multiple databases consolidates results, and highlights trends to facilitate decision-making.
Additional duties as assigned.



This is a remote role but candidates must be located within driving distance of our Seattle or Miami offices.

Requirements

Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Business Analytics, Economics, Engineering, STEM or a relatable field required
2-3 years of experience with Salesforce Service Cloud, Sales Cloud and Marketing Cloud
A minimum of 2 years of relevant hands-on experience in supporting Salesforce
Minimum 2 years of full-time experience with analytics/project management/project-solving/database management
Salesforce Administrator, Advanced Administrator, or Salesforce App Builder certification a plus
Confidence to interact with all levels in the organization and lead team training efforts and projects.
Strong data analytical skills with experience in reporting and interpretation through compiling large amounts of data into an understandable format to support problem-solving.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to succinctly synthesize data, develop recommendations, create slides, and present
Highly proficient in MS Office (PowerPoint, Teams, Word
Proven track record of training with experience training in an adult learning environment using different delivery channels – virtual, in-person, technology-based training
Excellent presentation, facilitation, communication, and listening skills.
Customer-centric attitude with knowledge of or ability to learn emerging technologies and digital tools.
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Holland America is unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of employment visas at this time (e.g., H-1B status).

What You Can Expect

Cruise and Travel Privileges for You and Your Family
Health Benefits
401(k)
Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Training & Professional Development
Tuition & Professional Certification Reimbursement
Rewards & Incentives
Base Salary Range: $78,200.00 to $105,600.00. The range is applicable for the labor market where the role is intended to be hired. Final base salary is directly related to each candidates' qualifications and experience uniquely.

Our Culture… Stronger Together

Our highest responsibility and top priority is compliance, environmental protection and the health, safety and well-being of our guests, the people in the communities we touch and serve, and our shipboard and shoreside employees. Please visit our site to learn more about our Culture Essentials, Corporate Vision Statement and our Core Values at: https://www.hollandamerica.com/en_US/our-company/mission-values.html

#HAL

POSITION SUMMARY

This position reports to the IT Manager, is a member of the Technology department. The role of the Business Analyst will focus on Westwood’s core ERP (Vessel Supply Chain) Application. Which includes owning the installation and configuration of product updates, integrations with key business systems, and deployment of the application ecosystem into both pre-production and production systems. Efforts will also encompass supporting release management activities and response to break/fix issues.


The successful candidate will need to have experience working with application systems, advanced technology, and problem-solving skills, working as a team member as well as being a self-starter. Additionally, strong attention to detail, organization, and planning, as well as strong written and verbal communication skills, are required. This position may be part of, or liaison with, a large project team in a fast-paced, results-oriented, and collaborative environment. The role requires clear and effective communication skills with both technical and non-technical persons. Must be flexible and able to handle changing priorities over multiple projects, tasks, and situations.


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Maintain installations of our ERP software modules in multiple environments. This requires working closely with technology team members, internal business partners, and external suppliers.
Work cohesively within the Technology Department to ensure the information on the systems and all associated activities are captured in the appropriate Technology knowledge repository system.
Participate in Product Release and Implementation Processes
Own and drive resolution of Production Issues on Business Systems
Support other Business Analysts as a subject matter related to software systems.
Manage relationships and provide a positive primary point of contact with external software vendors.
Contribute to team effort by performing other duties as assigned and accomplishing related results as needed.
Participate in after hours on-call rotation (less than once a month)

Participate in Quarterly Release Projects (weekend activity)


SUPPLEMENTAL FUNCTIONS

Performs other duties as needed and/or assigned.


KEY WORK RELATIONSHIPS

The IT Business Analyst will work closely with all employees and will require a demonstration of strong competency and exemplary trustworthiness. The incumbent will coordinate with other members of the company including the leadership team such as Vice Presidents and Department Managers. The incumbent must be respectful of individuals of different cultural differences and personalities. This position will also interact with contractors on an occasional basis.


EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

Minimum of a four-year bachelor’s (BS) degree in computer science, data analysis, information systems or equivalent.
Minimum of three to five (3-5) years’ experience in key functions listed; with focus on active participation on software development team, software implementation, business analysis, and process design.
Experience with Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook)


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES

Experienced with application support or engineering
Advanced PC software skills, particularly advanced Office 365
SQL knowledge
Integration and Interface Knowledge (EDI, XML, API)
Basic Windows Task scheduler and Job/Services Management skills.
Basic Networking and Window Server Skills.
Basic working knowledge of internal IT controls: assessment, development and monitoring.
Attention to detail, strong organizational skills and driven to meet deadlines.
Strong oral and written communication skills.
Excellent interpersonal and teaming skills.
Strong analytical skills and problem-solving ability.
Ability to identify issues, analyze options, and recommend a course of action to diverse audience.
Remain positive and energetic while meeting project deadlines.
Self-starter, able to work with minimal supervision.
Must enjoy a dynamic environment and be able to remain flexible and manage multiple priorities.
Familiarity with the maritime and/or transportation industries, desired but not required.


PHYSICAL DEMANDS

To successfully perform the essential duties of this position, an individual must be able to stand, walk, or sit for extended periods of time. The work environment consists of exposure to physical conditions typical of a normal office environment. Work is classified as moderate in physical requirements. Must be able to support or lift and carry 1-10 pounds frequently, 20-40 pounds occasionally. Must be able to extend hand(s) or arm(s) in any direction. Also requires manual dexterity sufficient to operate a keyboard, photocopier, telephone, calculator, and other office equipment as necessary. Work requires high attention and mental demands, including the ability to prioritize and process information with accuracy and clarity. The ability to handle mentally stressful situations and maintain high level of sensitivity towards confidential information is also required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to assist individuals with disabilities to perform essential position functions.


LIMITATIONS AND DISCLAIMER

The above position description is meant to describe the general nature and level of work performed; it is not intended as an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities and required skills for the position. Westwood Shipping Line employees will be required to follow any other position-related instructions and to perform other duties requested by their supervisor in compliance with Federal and State laws. Requirements are representative of minimum levels of knowledge, skills and/or abilities necessary to perform each duty proficiently. Continued employment remains on an "at-will" basis.


COMPANY SUMMARY

Westwood Shipping Lines is owned by Swire Shipping, part of the Swire Group. Westwood operates a fleet of vessels in the North Pacific, providing marine transportation between the Pacific Northwest and North Asia. The international shipping company generates $400M in revenue. The corporate office is in the South Hill area of Puyallup, Washington.


Our approach to success is our personal service and versatility combined with reliable schedules and superior handling capabilities to safely transport your cargo. Oversized cargo, containers, breakbulk, and forest products sail together on Westwood ships. Our flexible ship design permits safe and efficient handling of all types of cargo – no matter how bulky or fragile.


Westwood's people make the difference. Our dedicated customer service and delivery teams provide a personalized approach that is unique in today's transportation environment.


Please visit the website at: wsl.com

Job Title: Sr. Business Analyst, Seller External Relations, Selling Partner Empowerment, Communities, and Trust - Data Science & Analytics
Job Description:
Bachelor's degree
Experience with Excel
Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders
Business Analysts (BAs) are the bridge between our internal leaders, policy makers, and Selling Partners (SPs) to help provide the right data at the right time to influence policies on how Amazon is able to support Independent Sellers. BAs work directly with product, program, and policy owners to understand their needs and help them retrieve and analyze the data to meet those needs. They partner with the business leaders to ensure that the right strategic decisions are made, making suggestions as to what data could help solve their core business questions. The analyses and insights they provide directly inform policy makers on how Amazon is supporting our SPs and influences the way that this relationship will continue to grow. When we don’t have the right data accessible, BAs work directly with Business Intelligence and Data Engineers (BIEs and DEs) to build requirements on data acquisition and storage to ensure that we have that data accessible long term. The Sr. Business Analyst will use data to translate the 'voice of the seller' into actionable insights that drive the development of our program roadmap and new product features required for high-quality communications to our Selling Partners.

Key job responsibilities

Write code in SQL to retrieve, analyze this data, and build dashboards and visualizations in AWS Quicksight and Tableau to ensure that business leaders have access to data and insights to inform on our strategies and operations
Analytical work to propose adjustments on external platforms
Work with data engineers on our team on the right mechanisms to continuously inspect and influence the direction that our organization will take.
Fulfill adhoc data and insights requests from Policy and PR teams
About the team
The Selling Partner Empowerment, Communities, & Trust (SPECT) organization builds lasting connections with, and helps drive the success of our Selling Partners. An important part of this charter is understanding our impact on and opportunities to improve public perception that Amazon is good for our Selling Partner’s businesses. The Seller External Relations (SER) team within SPECT is responsible for ensuring that external perception mirrors the reality that Amazon’s stores are a great place for third-party sellers to build and maintain thriving businesses.

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Seattle, WA, USA


Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights

Job Title: SDS Quality Analyst, SDS Quality Analytics
Job Description:
2+ years of relevant experience in a business analyst, data analyst, or statistical analysis role
Experience in SQL and manipulating large data sets in a database
Understanding of Agile Project Management (with Scrum or Kanban)
Shipping & Delivery Support (SDS) is looking for an energetic, curious, and customer obsessed Quality Analyst to help optimize the global Driver and Recipient support experiences. We are looking for a creative thinker with deep analytics experience who knows how to execute and deliver from concept. Ability and enthusiasm to be a leader on a team operating in a highly ambiguous environment is required.

The ideal candidates will have a rock-solid background in data analysis, including experience extracting and manipulating data using SQL, leveraging advanced Excel features for data analysis, and producing digestible business intelligence and actionable information. Candidates should also have strong communication and project management skills, enabling them to work with key business stakeholders to understand requirements and shape analytical deliverables. They should also have a demonstrated ability to think analytically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to work cross-organizationally. A keen sense of ownership, drive, and scrappiness is a must.

Continuously advocate for customers
Work with international cross-functional teams
Design and execute analytic projects in collaboration with business, product, data engineering, finance, business analysts, and other specialists.
Build data visualization reports and tools for self-service consumption of data, e.g., Tableau, Quicksight, and custom solutions.
Analyze and extract relevant information from large amounts of both structured and unstructured data to help automate and optimize key processes, providing reliable insights.
Partner with data engineering teams to improve data assets, quality, metrics and insights.
Proactively identify opportunity areas for deep dive investigations and future program development.
Write concise documents communicating results to stakeholders and visualize data to drive decision making.
About the team
Shipping & Delivery Support (SDS) is a customer service organization dedicated to building world class support for Amazon’s transportation products and services across all customer segments.

Seattle, WA, USA

Job Title: Senior Business Analyst, Selling Partner Insights and Analytics
Job Description:
7+ years of tax, finance or a related analytical field experience
5+ years of writing SQL queries and creating business intelligence reports using Tableau, Power BI experience
Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders
Experience with Excel
Knowledge of Basic Statistics
Selling Partner (SP) Insights and Analytics team mission is to build listening mechanisms to gather frictionless SP feedback, generate insights at scale, and enable teams to prioritize and measure improvement opportunities. Selling Partner Insights and Analytics focuses on surfacing SP sentiment data/insights and connecting our stakeholders to actual SP experiences.

The Selling Partner Insights and Analytics team performs analyses, creates visualizations and develops automated reporting solutions that inform decisions and inspire change. The Selling Partner Insights and Analytics transforms requirements into insights and deliver reporting that enable our business partners to improve the seller partner experience. This team supports all programs where the data/analysis is needed for program teams, Operations and stakeholders from the broader Selling Partner Support team.

Key job responsibilities
The Senior Business Analyst, Selling Partner Insights and Analytics will be focusing on analyzing emerging and new quality, experience and operational metrics for Selling Partners. This includes metrics measuring new contact channels like Chat and Escalate my Case, but also Global Operation metrics (NRR, service level, first touch resolution, average handling time and so on).

The successful candidate will have strong business acumen and possess excellent statistical and analytical abilities. They will focus on creating actionable insights and research to provide recommendations to the leadership team and build scalable solutions to meet business needs. They will have passion for data and analytics, be an independent innovator comfortable with ambiguity. They'll have strong attention to detail, an ability to work in a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment.

The ideal candidate for this role will should be:

Self-starter who understands the current and future business needs by working closely with stakeholders to recognize their needs and requirements.
Individual who will support the long-term strategy to implement self-service solutions and focus on insights research while understanding and have experience working with Customer service/Operation teams.
Hands-on individual who has deep domain/process expertise across operational metrics, someone who can understand individual metrics and how they are all connected.
Proactively identify problems with significant business impact; facilitate analysis to identify problems and opportunities to deliver insights and recommendations to help shape strategy across team and measurement initiatives.
Working with the data engineering and Science team to build the business requirements to evolve the insights and analysis about the SP experience.
Set and articulate expectations around leadership behavior for peers; model behavior that exemplifies Amazon Leadership Principles.

Company Name: State of Washington Office of Financial Management
Job Description:
Description




Please Note: Based on the compensation range we are advertising the starting salary offer will be determined based on the successful candidates’ qualifications within the budgeted salary range of $55,000 – $76,560 annually. However, there is ability for longevity growth and progression in salary for the individual once employed.

This position is anticipated to last no more than 9-12 months. Our physical office is in Olympia WA. This position is flexible/hybrid, with the ability to work from home, and some travel to in-person activities, meetings, and events.

What this job is about:
As a temporary Financial Analyst within the Fiscal and Operations Unit, you will aid in the Office of Financial Management's (OFM) mission to support and improve government on behalf of all Washingtonians. You will perform complex fiscal analysis to ensure vendor payments, general ledger account balances, and other areas of responsibility are in accordance with SAAM, GAAP, statutes, and regulations. During these analyses, you will also consult with executive leadership, agency management and staff within OFM, the Governor’s Office, Office of Independent Investigations and statutorily attached offices and commissions.

Who we are:
Our work at the Office of Financial Management (OFM) serves as a crucial part of the decision-making that the governor, Legislature and state agencies do each year. As an employee of OFM, you will be part of a team of dedicated professionals who work hard every day to provide the vital information and services they need to serve the people of Washington.

If playing a key role in supporting and improving state government matters to you, you’ve found the right place!

What we offer our employees:
Foster an environment of diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging. We strive to hire, cultivate and retain a competitive workforce that reflects the communities we serve.
Encourage a healthy life/work balance by offering flexible/alternative work schedules, wellness program, mobile arrangements and telework opportunities.
Employees (and their families) have coverage options for medical, dental, vision and basic life insurance.
Opportunity to enroll in state retirement programs and a deferred compensation plan.
A minimum of 14 days of vacation leave per year and 12 paid holidays throughout the calendar year.
OFM offers a commute trip reduction program, tuition reimbursement, membership to statewide Business Resource Groups and an Infants-at-Work program.
See our Benefits page for more information.



Duties

What you’ll do:



Process invoices and travel vouchers for the Office of Financial Management, Governor’s Office and Office of Independent Investigations in a timely and accurate manner.
Perform complex general ledger reconciliations, analyze data to answer questions and resolve problems related to accounts payable, accounts receivable, and general ledger balances. Reconcile, review, analyze and verify data from multiple sources and correct discrepancies as necessary.
Assist Fiscal & Ops leadership with transition to Workday, and act as liaison for the agency billing system (ABS) and cash receipting system (Computron) transition to Workday.
Serve as the key financial advisor to the Financial Services Manager on issues related to fiscal year close activities for billing and cash receipts.
Serve as agency expert for specialized accounting activities in the Agency Billing System, Computron accounts receivable system, US Bank Lock Box processing and document billing and cash receipt processes and procedures.

Qualifications

Required:

A Bachelor’s degree, which includes 18 quarter or 12 semester hours in accounting, auditing, or budgeting (professional experience may substitute for education, but not the required credit hours).
Two years of relevant professional accounting experience, one year of which was performing advanced/complex accounting and /or fiscal analysis.
Demonstrated ability to research and analyze information from multiple sources.
Strong technical skills to produce quality work products using multiple types of Microsoft office products, various financial and reporting systems.
Intermediate to advanced skills utilizing Microsoft Excel (Pivot Tables, VLookup) and other products to support electronic work processes.
Exceptional attention to detail and organizational skills to maintain accurate and timely payments, while applying appropriate OFM/GOV/OII agency policies, SAAM, GAAP and Federal Grant requirements and regulations.
Desired:

Knowledge of and experience with AFRS, SAAM and GAAP.
Adaptability: Embrace lean leadership and the development of the lean culture at OFM/GOV.

Job Title: Business Analyst III - Accounting & Data Governance, IS Operational Experience
Job Description:
Company Description


“We’re not in the shipping business; we’re in the information business” -Peter Rose, Expeditors Founder

Global supply chain management is what we do, but at the heart of Expeditors you will find professionalism, leadership, and a friendly environment, all of which foster an innovative, customer service-based approach to logistics.

18,000 trained professionals
350+ locations worldwide across 60+ countries
Fortune 500
Globally unified systems


Job Description


Global logistics is complex. Accurate and timely accounting of services we purchase or provide is essential to our company's success. Expeditors' ongoing growth and success relies on providing exceptional customer service and reducing financial risk. We are looking for strong and driven candidates who want to help design and develop highly available, responsive, secure, and robust systems supporting our accounting and finance business functions. You will be part of an Agile Team to ensure our systems support our users, and ultimately shareholders by creating accounting transactions the right way, the first time. You will have a direct role in driving a shared understanding of business goals, objectives between Business and IT in delivering quality systems that meet business needs, with a reputation of on-time delivery and with a commitment to complete and accurate financial data. By employing a variety of business, process, data, and system analysis techniques, the Business Analyst aligns stakeholders, reduces ambiguity and risk, and defines solutions that meet defined goals and objectives. The successful Business Analyst in Accounting & Data Governance group is passionate about solving complex business problems, aligning stakeholders to solutions, and modeling data and processes.

Responsibilities:

Collaborate with Product Manager(s) in building and prioritizing team backlog.
Take ownership of defining and driving the analysis process while proactively collaborate with the team.
Elicit and analyze functional and non-functional requirements. Craft meaningful requirements and specifications that align stakeholder needs to system capabilities. Clearly define user stories.
Lead requirements, specification reviews and backlog grooming sessions to achieve shared understanding.
Collaborate to design high-value and sensible IS solutions, making sure both functional and non-functional requirements are addressed in the design and the testing early on.
Assist the team in achieving team goals, e.g., assisting with testing activities when needed.
Proactively and continuously improve business and system knowledge and improve processes.

This position is on-site and will reside in the greater Seattle, WA. area at one of the following locations depending on availability. Candidates must be local or willing to relocate. Relocation assistance is not offered for this position.

Downtown Seattle
Federal Way
Lynnwood
Bellevue (Factoria)


Qualifications


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor's degree, or its equivalent, in Computer Science or a closely related field of study (such as Management Information Systems).
3+ years of business, process, data, and system analysis experience in software development.
Aptitude for business analysis demonstrated through applied skills and knowledge.
Effective at navigating ambiguity and driving diverse teams towards clarity and consensus.
Effective at eliciting, analyzing, and crafting meaningful stakeholder requirements and specifications.
Effective at researching and resolving issues.
Ability to simplify the complex business and technical needs.
Ability to clearly communicate details and concepts to a broad range of audiences.
Ability to compose concepts, ideas, and designs into actionable, measurable deliverables.
Broad knowledge of database structures, data relationships, and data modeling.
Experience working with Reference Data, Data Governance products.
Effective at managing multiple and competing priorities.
Excellent time management and organization skills.
Demonstrated leadership.
Proven interpersonal skills and outstanding verbal, written communication
Customer service mindset.
Proficiency with the system development lifecycle, including agile techniques.

DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS

Understanding of the transportation / logistics industry.
Working knowledge of the Unified Modeling Language (UML) with the ability to effectively communicate business requirements through Business Object Models, State Diagrams, and other UML diagrams.
Knowledge of Business Analysis Body of Knowledge (BABOK).
SAFe familiarity and/or certification.

Applicants are required to be eligible to lawfully work in the U.S. immediately; employer will not transfer or sponsor applicants for U.S. work authorization (such as an H-1B visa) for this opportunity.


Additional Information


Expected base salary: $105,000 to $137,000

May be eligible for bonus following first year of continuous employment in position.

Expeditors offers excellent benefits:

Paid Vacation (first year prorated based off month of hire then eligible for 15 days)
Holidays (10)
Flexible Days (2)
Paid Sick Time (accrual rate of 1 hour of sick time per 30 hours paid)
401(k) Retirement Savings Plan with employer match
Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
Medical, Prescription Drug, Dental & Vision Coverage
Health Savings Account (HSA)
Life and Disability Insurance
Paid Parental Leave (additional eligibility criteria)
Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account (DC FSA)
Commuter Benefit
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Training and Personnel Development Program
Educational Assistance and Reimbursement
Position is full time (40 hours per week) Monday through Friday
Business professional dress code

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO Guidelines.

Responsible for a variety of Finance related functions to include developing pro forma work on existing and new services, updating the multi-year forecast model and ongoing analysis of the cost accounting system and service line reporting. Assist the Director during the annual operating budget cycle. Use advanced computer techniques to retrieve and analyze data and present results to management.

Develop financial models and conduct in-depth analysis. This will include documenting methodologies and assumptions needed to perform analysis of volumes, revenues and expenses. Incorporate demand analysis from Strategic Planning to include demographic, utilization, market share and physician referral patterns. Develop reimbursement assumptions for impact of differences in payer reimbursement methodologies. Compile and validate operating expense and capital assumptions. Prepare sensitivity analysis and calculate net present value (NPV) and internal rates of return (IRR). Review for legal, regulatory and tax implication issues and coordinate issue resolution with other departments that have expertise in those areas.
Prepare routine analysis of the cost accounting system and assist with annual system maintenance. Demonstrate high-level of understanding for decision support systems and cost accounting. Assist Strategic Data Resources with the annual maintenance of the cost accounting system. Work to improve the accuracy of the cost models. Assist in the education of leadership on the appropriate use of cost accounting information to help them when analyzing the performance of business segments.
Develop and maintain reports to evaluate service level profitability. Monitor and prepare periodic program and service line performance evaluations in conjunction with Strategic Planning. Analyze actual to projected performance and offer insight in to deviations. Provide training to financial analysts and users of service level data.
Develop standardized practices for completing pro formas and routine financial analysis and continue to refine/enhance standardization practices.

Qualifications:

Require Bachelors Degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business. MBA preferred.
HFMA membership desired.
Requires five years experience in finance. Health care experience preferred.
Previous experience in Axiom, Syntellus, or Kaufma Hall LRFP preferred.
Requires experience using Microsoft Excel, Access and Word. Demonstrates a high-level of experience in using a Decision Support System with prior experience using Alliance Decision Support (MedAssets), Axiom, and Budget Advisor (Kaufman Hall) is highly desirable.
Requires strong organizational skills and ability to handle multiple projects in a fast paced environment.
Results driven, highly motivated, positive attitude, and curious with a growth mindset and willingness to learn
Ability to work independently and think strategically
Comfortable working with ambiguity in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
Requires excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Company Name: State of Washington Dept. of Social and Health Services
Job Description:
Description

Fiscal Analyst 2

We’re seeking a permanent Fiscal Analyst 2 to join our Facilities, Finance, and Analytics Administration (FFA) team in Medical Lake, WA.

The position supports the DSHS mission of Transforming by performing Payroll Processor functions and the functions of Local Funds/Accumatica fiscal analyst for Lakeland Village. The Fiscal Analyst 2 will perform high quality journey level professional financial review and analysis of accounting and auditing of fiscal data in accordance with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles, Governmental Auditing Standards, and both State and Federal statues or regulations.

Some of what you'll do



Assist the Fiscal analyst 4 payroll Processor position with payroll functions, including; processing, analyzing, and reconciling payroll related activities to include accuracy of pay, health insurance, long term disability, retirement, federal income tax withholding, miscellaneous deductions, garnishments, assault benefits, shared leave, and all other leave activities
Input of payroll, person, appointment, terminations of employment and all related pay, twice monthly, preparing and processing overpayments, assault benefits, adjustments to gross as necessary, mandatory and voluntary deductions, AFRS account coding and customer service
Initiate interaction and respond to inquiries from HR Reps, Time and Attendance Processors, and employees of DSHS via telephone, postal mail, and email
Develop, review, analyze, research, and interpret payroll accounting and financial reports from the HRMS system
Verify, reconcile, and analyze data to ensure all aspects of DSHS employees are paid correctly
Assist and back up the Fiscal Analyst 3 in the local funds department, including; analyzing, auditing local funds records, and preparing end of month JV’s to be entered into the State accounting systems
Apply and adapt established accounting methods to a variety of transactions

What we're looking for

Knowledge about and understanding of theory and practice of accounting; principles of cost accounting; modern office methods
Ability to apply and adapt established accounting methods to a variety of accounting transactions; assemble, analyze, and prepare reports and statements of complex financial data
Ability to process large quantities of fiscal data consistency, accuracy, and efficiency
Ability to multi-task and schedule self to meet payment and report deadlines
Excellent communication skills and the ability to work effectively with staff at all levels. Optimize limited resources, and support the organizational goals
Working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, and Local Funds system Accumatica
Must understand and comply with facility policy and procedures

Professionals with one of the following should apply:

Professionals with a bachelor’s degree, which includes 18 quarter or 12 semester hours in accounting, auditing, or budgeting AND one to two years of relevant professional experience;

OR

A Master's degree in a financial-related field, certified as a Public Accountant, Internal Auditor, Certified Governmental Financial Manager, or Management Accountant can be substituted for professional experience.

Note: Professional experience may substitute for education, but not for the credit hours;

Core office hours: Mon-Fri, 7:15 am - 4:15 pm.
Position is located full time onsite at Lakeland Village in Medical Lake, WA.

To Apply:

Completed application will include the additional following information:

Resume
Unofficial college transcripts
Letter of interest describing your experience related to this job
Provide a minimum of three professional references

Job Title: Health Data Analyst - Health Information Management - FT Days
Job Description:
Responsible for the assignment of all ICD-10-CM Diagnostic and Procedural Codes for all inpatient & outpatient services. Abstract information into the Hospital’s Information System. A critical attribute required of this position is exceptional interpersonal customer services consisting of an outgoing positive attitude, warm friendly joyful demeanor, and the utmost care and respect for our guests, patients, families, customers and colleagues.

Salary Range: $21.41 - $27.40

Registered Health Information Administrator, Registered Health Information Technician or graduate from a Health Information management program preferred
Two (2) years' of ICD
-10-CM Diagnostic and Procedural Coding: Two years of CPT-4 Procedural Coding Preferred.
American Health Information Management - or American Academy of Professional Coders credential, Certified Coding Associate or Certified Professional Coder required within 90 days of hire REQUIRED. In the event that the associate should not pass the CCA within the 90 day timeframe the associate will be transferred into a HDA Trainee position. The associate will then have 45 days to retake the CCA exam. In the event the associate does not pass the exam or fails to meet the deadline the associate will be terminated from Lourdes Health Network. In the event that the associate does not sit for the CCS/CCS-P exam by the two (2) year anniversary of hire the associate will be immediately put on Administrative leave without pay. The associate will then have one (1) week to provide the CCS/CCS-P certification to the HIM Manager. In the event that the associate does not comply and/or sit for the CSS/CCS-P they will be terminated from Lourdes Heath Network immediately. In the event that the associate does not pass the CCS/CCS-P they will be moved to a HDA Trainee position. The associate will have 120 days to retake the exam. If the associate does not pass the exam or fails to meet the deadline the associated will be terminated immediately.

Job Title: Business Analyst, Selling Partner Support, Effective Resolution
Job Description:
1+ years of tax, finance or a related analytical field experience
2+ years of complex Excel VBA macros writing experience
Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
Experience with SQL or ETL
Do you enjoy solving complex business problems, transforming data into insights, and using data to drive product decisions? In this position, you will directly support a globalized product that provides a layer of intelligence to display, analyze, and recommend where our customers should focus to improve their performance and efficiency. You will also give input towards defining and improving key product metrics as well as opportunities to build new solutions to business problems.

Partnering with key stakeholders, you will utilize a range of data sources and analytical tools to dig deep into the business challenges to understand and identify insights. This will directly support core product features for our customers and improve the utility of our solutions. You'll build sustainable, scalable and automated analytics that help the organization understand opportunities for efficiency and performance improvements. You will work closely with product managers, SDEs, data engineers, and senior management to define new metrics and project requirements.

In this role, you will work directly with operations teams, program, product, and tech resources to develop and execute a cross-team roadmap. You’ll work backwards from our frontline Associates’ daily work to develop an understanding of the way our operations teams function. You’ll then partner with our global operations leadership teams to map out their needs, creating a strategy for how to effectively deliver data driven insights and increase overall operations optimization. You’ll shape our long-term strategy in a rapidly evolving landscape. With stakeholders across multiple teams, there will be frequent opportunities to influence significant decisions.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Develop and own the long-term vision, strategy, and roadmap for your portfolio, and think big to continuously identify new techniques and approaches worthy of investment.
Partner with business and technology stakeholders and leaders across the organization to drive strategic initiatives through leadership and influence.
Operate with significant autonomy to deliver results and achieve the goals and objectives of both your team and the broader organization.
Provide thought leadership for critical experiments that help to validate hypotheses, and continue to challenge the status quo.
Develop ways to measure the effectiveness of insights and analytical recommendations provided to global operations teams.
Key job responsibilities
You will learn and understand our global operations, database infrastructure, and existing performance management system functionalities. After establishing this knowledge, you will need to develop a robust set of metrics and reporting solutions to help uncover opportunities, prioritize fixes, and influencing leadership to help drive investments that reduce waste. Some of these metrics do not exist, requiring critical thought and data/metrics design. This will include complex analytics, mapping systems and datasets together, developing scalable reporting solutions, and producing narratives/documents outlining key insights and trends meant to drive investment as well as measuring the efficacy of solutions implemented over time to attribute success and impact.

A day in the life
You will work closely with product, program, and tech teams in order to stay connected to the ongoing feature launch roadmaps. The Selling Partners Support ecosystem is constantly evolving and our analytics systems must be maintained and adapted to ensure our measurement strategy and reporting mechanisms accommodate these changes. You will build a variety of analytics and visualization solutions to support our product features. You will autonomously perform deep dives, uncovering new trends/areas that may need attention. You will also work closely with our product team to help design experiments and look for new opportunities.

About the team
Our team is focused on operations workforce optimization for the SP-Support organization. The team consists of experienced product managers, analysts, and data scientists, with deep knowledge of how to build and manage a variety of successful programs and products. This is a small team of experts whose focus is making sure our analytics solutions match the needs of our business as we grow and scale without impacting our ability to support Selling Partners.

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Seattle, WA, USA


Experience working with Tableau
Experience using very large datasets

Experience communicating and presenting, both written and oral

Amazon Web Services (“AWS”) has been the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. AWS offers over 100 fully featured services to millions of active customers around the world—including the fastest-growing startups, largest enterprises, and leading government agencies—to power their infrastructure. AWS Worldwide Revenue (WWRO) is a diverse team that supports infrastructure and other foundational initiatives that span and support , Marketing and teams within AWS.

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

AWS Private Deal Enablement (a WWRO team) is in need of a talented and highly motivated to help us order entry and receivables for the AWS Global Program. We're looking for a self-starter who's passionate about understanding the details and managing processes to both and external customers.

Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.

About Us
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Key Responsibilities

Responsible for the day to day delivery, tracking, and management receivables.
Creation and implementation of standard operating procedures and process workflows.
Will actively seek innovative solutions to business trends on behalf of experience, and communicate updates to leadership
Retrieve and analyze data using Excel, and other data management/BI systems to provide insightful and actionable reports to the team.
Directly interact with Public Sector and Marketing Sponsors by responding timely and accurately to questions and requests for information.
Manage and resolve discrepancies to ensure timely and accurate receivables.
Maintain relationships and communication by responding timely and accurately to both, internal and external questions, and requests for information.
A day in the life

About the hiring group

Job responsibilities

Threat Tec, LLC is the leader of Operational Environment (OE) replication and Threat Emulation/Wargaming solutions. Threat Tec brings innovative thinking and extensive experience to complex challenges for public and private sector customers. We work alongside our nation's defenders, developing solutions that drive success and protect our future. Join a team that is embodied by an unwavering commitment to professionalism, honesty, and innovation.

Threat Tec, LLC, a Veteran-Owned Small Business, has openings for an Incentives and Proficiency Data Analyst to join our growing company at Joint Base Lewis McCord, WA.

SUMMARY:
The Incentives and Proficiency Data Analyst will support the database and Foreign Language Proficiency Bonus (FLPB) task, this includes input and query the Special Operations Foreign Language Office (SOFLO) database to assess and analyze language training database statistics; thereby enhancing the effectiveness of the unit Language Training Program. The Analyst will collect and synchronize all data and databases from subordinate units for the purpose of conducting consolidated analysis and compiling required reports. The Analyst will manage the FLPB Program for the unit, IAW Service and organizational policy. The Analyst will develop new and improve current procedures as needed. The Analyst contractor shall be responsible for managing all paperwork and procedures to assist the unit change Control Languages for applicable SOF personnel through Service processes.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Assess and analyze Special Operations Foreign Language Office (SOFLO) database statistics to enhance the effectiveness of the 1st SFC LREC Training Program.
Collect and synchronize all data and databases from subordinate commands.
Manage the 1st SFC Foreign Language Proficiency Bonus (FLPB) Program.
Manage paperwork and procedures to assist 1st SFC to change Control Languages for all assigned Special Forces, Civil Affairs, and Military Information Support Soldiers through Human Resources Command (HRC).
Understand and apply all relevant Service and local policies as effect incentives and language testing. Draft changes to policy to better support 1st SFC.
Draft and review documentation, provide corrections and provide recommended corrections.
Compile data as required, prepare reports, and create presentations suitable for senior audiences (military grades O6 to O8).


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS AND EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS:

Graduated high school or possess a GED.
At least 2-years’ experience working on military pay or personnel issues.
Proficient in the use all current Microsoft Office applications and SharePoint.
Experience performing tasks listed above.

DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Ability to interact on a professional level with administration, faculty, students, and all personnel.
Effective use of diplomacy, tact, and judgment.
Ability to work well independently; demonstrated creativity, self-discipline, and organization; and ability to search and understand new technologies and their potential.


TRAVEL:
CONUS and OCONUS Travel will be required.

Job Title: Quality Data Analyst - RN - FT - ASH - Onsite
Job Description:
The Astria Health system, headquartered in the heart of the state of Washington’s wine country in the beautiful Yakima Valley, is the largest non-profit healthcare system based in Eastern Washington. Astria Health is the parent non-profit organization of Astria Sunnyside Hospital and Astria Toppenish Hospital and delivers care throughout the Valley through its Astria Health Hospitals and its Astria Ambulatory Care model focused on delivering the highest level of ambulatory and outpatient care in convenient locations in both the Lower and Upper Yakima Valley. Astria Ambulatory Care is designed to meet the changing lifestyles and diverse needs of those living and working throughout the region.

Experience: Minimum of one-year clinical experience preferred
Education: Bachelor's/Masters preferred
Knowledge/Skills/Abilities: Cognitive skills as related to the position, Excellent interpersonal skills required including communication, writing, and presentation skills, Advanced working knowledge of spreadsheets and databases, must have strong knowledge base of Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word
Licenses/Registrations/Certifications: Maintain a current state social worker license, Current WA State RN license
Analyzes and aggregates data for reporting as directed (ie. MIPS, Medicaid measures)
Performs chart reviews, aggregates data, prepares reports, completes targeted audits as requested
Models problem solving using PDCA model to make improvements
Participates in interdisciplinary teams to support and promote patient safety through quality improvement
Collects, aggregates, analyzes data that may include but not limited to chosen quality measures, antibiotic stewardship, opioid safety
Understands change theory and utilizes the most effective techniques to impact successful project implementation
Assisting with the development and sustaining a patient advisory council
Coordinating efforts to complete OPPE, FPPE
Demonstrates clear ownership of workplace and patient safety.
Reports mistakes, near misses, adverse events and quality and safety concerns.
Participates in the development and implementation of safety and quality improvement activities.
Protects patient confidentiality and abides by all HIPAA and privacy laws.
Maintains up to date knowledge of standard revisions and regulatory guidelines to ensure all policies are survey ready and standard compliant- (Rural Health Clinic, The Joint Commission, ISDH)
Other duties as assigned.

The Quality Analyst is responsible for aggregating data via chart abstraction and coordinating submissions or reporting with the Chief of Clinical Quality. The Quality Analyst proactively interacts with staff to achieve high performance in quality improvement and standard compliance and coordinating accreditation activities. There are additional activities that the Quality Analyst participates in as defined by the needs of the organization and the unique skills of the Quality Analyst. The Chief of Clinical Quality provides general direction; however, this position operates with a high degree of independence and awareness of organization priorities.

Job Summary
Reposted 08/25/2023.

We are currently seeking skilled and team-oriented applicants for the following position: IT Business Analyst

The Instructional Technology and Web Services Business Analyst works at the strategic interface between IT and Stakeholder (institution, college, department, faculty, student, administration/staff, community, etc.) to provide support and direction for development, implementation, and use of technology through consultation and collaboration to ensure that the potential business value from IT systems and services is maximized and meets institutional goals.

This position is responsible for researching and developing best practices using technology in support of institutional systems, instructional design, and web services. Additionally, this position supports and maintains vendor relations. This position is directly involved with developing, delivering, and facilitating IT systems and services and must have knowledge of IT systems, concepts, and methods to meet institutional or stakeholder needs. This position identifies, explores, and conducts analysis on institutional data.

Instructional Technology and Web Services is a unit of Information Technology at EWU. This team is responsible for research, development, management, and review of academic technology and web service solutions. This includes learning management systems (LMS), content management systems (CMS), course development, course review, media systems and services (streaming, lecture and desktop capture, course recordings, etc), learning analytics, learning space design, technology events and workshops, audience response and surveys, scheduling services, and workflows.

On top of salary, the university offers a comprehensive benefits package including health insurance, life and disability insurance and retirement. In addition, EWU offers generous vacation and sick leave accruals, 12 paid holidays per year and fringe benefits, such as tuition waiver for employees, discounted EWU sports tickets and free transportation through STA buses. For additional information regarding insurance benefits please see our Benefits page: https://inside.ewu.edu/hr/benefits/insurance/.

EWU expands opportunities for personal transformation through excellence in learning.


About Eastern Washington University
Eastern Washington University, a regional, comprehensive public university with an enrollment of over 10,000 students, is one of six state-funded four-year institutions of higher education in Washington, each governed by its own board of trustees. EWU’s 300-acre main campus is located in Cheney, a community of 12,000 residents 16 miles southwest of Washington’s second largest city, Spokane. Eastern also offers programs in downtown Spokane at the innovative, energy-efficient Catalyst building and at Riverpoint, a campus shared with Washington State University. In addition, EWU programs can be found at select locations throughout the state, aligned with the needs of the community. Eastern contributes to the vitality of the region and the state through its wide array of bachelor’s and master’s degrees in over 100 fields of study, as well as applied doctorates in physical therapy and educational leadership, offering accessible pathways to career success and personal development to students of all socioeconomic and cultural backgrounds.
